QA.question: How do I send money with Wise?
QA.answer: 1. Sign up with Wise. 2. Type in the transfer amount. 3. Choose the transfer type. 4. Fill in your details. 5. Add the recipient's info. 6. Review the transfer details. 7. Select the transfer type and payment method. 8. Wait for confirmation.

QA.question: Can I send money using an email address if I don’t have the recipient's bank details?
QA.answer: Yes, you can enter the recipient's email address. If they're on Wise, their account will be found automatically. If they're not, they'll receive an email asking for their bank details.

QA.question: How can I make sure my recipient gets an exact amount?
QA.answer: Type the exact amount into the 'Recipient gets' box, and Wise will automatically tell you how much you need to send.

QA.question: What are the payment options for sending money through Wise?
QA.answer: Wise offers various payment methods, like bank account transfers. Each option comes with a fee and a specified time frame for money arrival. It’s usually cheapest to pay from your bank account.

QA.question: How will I know when my transfer is complete and the money is on its way?
QA.answer: Wise will confirm the transfer via email or in the app, and both you and your recipient will be notified when the money's on its way.

QA.question: How long does a transfer take?
QA.answer: Transfer time depends on the countries involved, the payment method, the time you pay for your transfer, and security checks. It can take a maximum of 2 working days, but it’s very rare that it takes this long.

QA.question: How can I get an estimate of the transfer time?
QA.answer: You can get an estimate by putting basic details into our transfer calculator on our homepage. The estimate will change when you actually set up your transfer with more information.

QA.question: Do the receiver's bank processing time affect the transfer duration?
QA.answer: Yes, how quick your transfer arrives depends on how quickly your recipient’s bank can process your money. We can't confirm when the money has reached and been processed by your recipient's bank.

QA.question: Are some payment methods quicker than others?
QA.answer: Yes, some payment methods are quicker than others. For example, card payments are normally instant, while bank transfers can take longer, especially SWIFT transfers.

QA.question: What factors can add extra time to my transfer?
QA.answer: We might need to verify your ID, address, or the source of your funds during the transfer process. These additional security checks can add extra time to your transfer on top of the initial estimation.

QA.question: Can I send exact amounts when transferring money?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send exact amounts by entering the desired amount in the calculator and clicking the padlock icon. This will lock the amount and add a 3% amount lock deposit to ensure the exact amount arrives. Any unused portion of the deposit will be refunded.

QA.question: What is the purpose of the 3% amount lock deposit?
QA.answer: The 3% amount lock deposit is used as a buffer to cover any exchange rate fluctuations, ensuring that your recipient receives the exact amount you want them to. Unused portions will be refunded to you.

QA.question: Do I always have to select the padlock icon to guarantee the recipient gets the exact amount?
QA.answer: No, if your money reaches the recipient within the guaranteed rate time without clicking the padlock, the amount will be fixed anyway, and you won't need the extra 3% deposit.

QA.question: In which currencies is the amount lock feature available?
QA.answer: Amount lock is available for transfers from GBP, EUR (for payments from mainland Europe), AUD, BGN, CHF, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, JPY, NOK, NZD, PLN, RON, SEK, and SGD.

QA.question: How will I be notified about my transfer?
QA.answer: You'll receive an email when we've received your money and when we've paid your transfer out.

QA.question: What if I don't receive an email about my transfer?
QA.answer: Check your spam or junk folder in case the email has been sent there.

QA.question: Will you contact me by phone about my transfer?
QA.answer: Most contact will come via email, but we might get in touch by phone if needed.

QA.question: How can I download a transfer receipt on the website?
QA.answer: 1. Go to Home. 2. Find the transfer, click on it, and choose the 3 dots on the right side. 3. Select Get PDF receipt. The receipt will open as a PDF in a new tab.

QA.question: How do I download a transfer receipt on the app?
QA.answer: 1. Go to Home. 2. Select the transfer. 3. Tap on Details. 4. Select Get PDF receipt (iOS) or Download transfer receipt (Android). The receipt will open as a PDF in a new tab.

QA.question: Can I download a transfer receipt in my preferred language?
QA.answer: Yes, for the website and iOS app, change your account language settings to your preferred language. Unfortunately, the language change function is not yet supported for the Android app.

QA.question: What does the transfer receipt include?
QA.answer: The receipt serves as confirmation and includes details like the transfer number, banking partner reference, and a unique tracking number for certain currencies.

QA.question: Can the recipient download the transfer receipt?
QA.answer: No, only the sender can download the receipt. The recipient should contact the sender to get the receipt forwarded to them.

QA.question: Do I need to pay any tax on transfers?
QA.answer: Wise may have to levy tax on its transfer fee according to local tax laws, and any transactional taxes will either be included in the fee payable or shown separately at the time of payment. Wise won't withhold any taxes on the money transferred.

QA.question: Will the recipient have to pay any taxes on the transferred money?
QA.answer: Wise will pay out the agreed amount to the recipient without withholding any taxes. You and/or the recipient may need to declare and pay tax depending on the nature of the transfer.

QA.question: Can Wise advise me on whether tax applies to my transfer?
QA.answer: Wise can't advise whether tax applies to your transfer. It's recommended that you consult a financial advisor and/or the relevant tax authority.

QA.question: How can I repeat a transfer?
QA.answer: You can repeat a transfer automatically from 3 different places: 1. When logged in to Wise, click on the transfer you wish to repeat and choose 'Repeat transfer'. 2. From the transfer page of a completed transfer, click 'Repeat this transfer' in the top right-hand corner. 3. From a payment confirmation page, access the transfer status page from the link in the email, then click 'Repeat this transfer' in the top right-hand corner.

QA.question: Can I send money from a joint bank account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send money from a joint bank account as long as you are one of the account holders and your name on the account matches the name on your Wise account.

QA.question: Do I need to enter the name of the other account holder when setting up a transfer?
QA.answer: Yes, you'll be asked to enter the name of the other bank account holder when setting up your transfer to help identify that it's coming from a joint account.

QA.question: Do I need to provide proof that a joint bank account is in my name?
QA.answer: Ordinarily, no. However, if banks send names on joint accounts incorrectly, Wise will email you and request a proof of joint account document.

QA.question: What is a proof of joint account document?
QA.answer: A proof of joint account document is a screenshot or PDF of your joint bank statement, clearly showing your name, the bank's name, and the account number.

QA.question: How long does it take to verify the joint account document?
QA.answer: The document will be checked within 2 working days of receiving it from you.

QA.question: Can I send money from someone else's bank account?
QA.answer: In most cases, no. The name on the bank account you're sending from must match the name on your Wise account. Exceptions include sending money from a joint bank account or a business bank account if you have a Wise Business account.

QA.question: Can I send money from a joint bank account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send money from a joint bank account if you're named on the account and that name matches the name on your Wise account.

QA.question: How can I send money from a business bank account?
QA.answer: You can send money from a business bank account if you have a Wise Business account and the name on the business bank account matches the business registered with Wise Business.

QA.question: What happens if someone else paid for a transfer using my Wise account?
QA.answer: You'll need to cancel the transfer, as Wise cannot process the money. The funds will be refunded to the sender's bank account.

QA.question: How long does a refund take?
QA.answer: Please refer to Wise's 'Learn how long a refund takes' guidance for information on refund processing times.

QA.question: How can I check the status of my transfer?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, click 'Details' on the transfer you’d like to track to see the money tracker.

QA.question: What are some reasons for a delayed transfer?
QA.answer: Reasons for a delayed transfer include: extra verification, recipient's bank still processing the transfer, and mistakes in the recipient's details.

QA.question: What if there is a mistake in the recipient's details?
QA.answer: Depending on the bank, they may process the transfer with a delay or send the money back to us. If a mistake was made, the sender should correct the details and send it again.

QA.question: How can I speed up the process after my money has been paid out?
QA.answer: Send a transfer receipt to the recipient's bank. Go to 'Home', click on 'Details' on the relevant transfer, click 'Get PDF receipt', and send it to the recipient's bank.

QA.question: How long does it usually take for transfers to arrive?
QA.answer: Over 80% of transfers are delivered within 2 hours of the estimated time on the money tracker. The exact time depends on the currency and recipient's bank.

QA.question: When can I expect my money to arrive?
QA.answer: When you make a transfer, Wise will give you an estimate for when your money should arrive, but it may vary depending on factors like recipient's details, bank processing times, and holidays.

QA.question: Will a typo in the recipient's name affect the transfer?
QA.answer: For most countries, small typos in names shouldn't be a problem, but for certain currencies like JPY or RUB, it can cause an issue.

QA.question: What happens if the recipient's account number is wrong?
QA.answer: If the account number is wrong, your money may take longer to arrive or get returned to us. If it gets returned, we'll notify you.

QA.question: How do weekends and holidays affect transfers?
QA.answer: Not all countries have banking systems that work on weekends or holidays. Wise's delivery times factor in the destination country's banking hours.

QA.question: How can I get a receipt for my transfer?
QA.answer: To get a receipt, log in to your Wise account, click on your transfer, and then click on the 3 dots on your browser to see the 'Get PDF receipt' button, or click the button directly in the app. Save it to your device and send it to your recipient.

QA.question: When is a transfer marked as 'Complete'?
QA.answer: A transfer is marked as 'Complete' when the money has been sent to the recipient bank.

QA.question: Why hasn't the money arrived even if the transfer is 'Complete'?
QA.answer: The receiving bank may still be processing the money, or the money has arrived but looks different in the recipient's account.

QA.question: How long might it take for the receiving bank to process the transfer?
QA.answer: It might take up to 1 working day for the receiving bank to process and release the money.

QA.question: What should the recipient check if they don't recognize the transfer?
QA.answer: The recipient should check the sender name, reference, currency, and amount using the transfer receipt.

QA.question: How can the recipient speed up the processing of the transfer?
QA.answer: The recipient can ask their bank to speed up the processing using a transfer receipt that has all the details.

QA.question: Why is my transfer taking so long?
QA.answer: Your transfer might be delayed due to the chosen payment method, weekends and holidays, or the receiving bank's processing time. You can speed things up by selecting a faster payment method, planning around weekends and holidays, or asking the receiving bank to clear the money faster.

QA.question: How can I speed up my transfer?
QA.answer: You can speed up your transfer by choosing a faster payment method, planning around weekends and holidays, or asking the receiving bank to clear the money faster.

QA.question: Does paying by card speed up my transfer?
QA.answer: Yes, if you pay by card, the transfer can be started immediately, speeding up the process.

QA.question: How do weekends and public holidays affect my transfer?
QA.answer: Banking hours, weekends, and public holidays are out of our control and might slow down the transfer process.

QA.question: Can the receiving bank speed up the transfer process?
QA.answer: Yes, your recipient can ask the receiving bank to clear the money faster by sharing the transfer receipt with them.

QA.question: What is a proof of payment?
QA.answer: A proof of payment can be a receipt or a screenshot from your online bank, showing details like your name, account number, bank's name, TransferWise Ltd details, date, amount, currency, and reference.

QA.question: When do I need to provide proof of payment?
QA.answer: We don’t always need proof when you make a transfer. If we do, we’ll ask you to upload it.

QA.question: What information should be visible in the proof of payment screenshot?
QA.answer: The screenshot should show your name, account number, bank’s name, TransferWise Ltd details, date, amount, currency, and reference.

QA.question: Do I need to provide a different proof of payment in Australia and New Zealand?
QA.answer: Yes, for Australia and New Zealand, you need to provide a recent bank statement showing your name, date of issue, and bank details in addition to the online banking screenshot.

QA.question: Can I provide just the bank statement instead of the online banking screenshot in Australia and New Zealand?
QA.answer: Yes, you can provide just the bank statement if it shows all the required details.

QA.question: What is a transfer number?
QA.answer: A transfer number is a unique identifier for every transfer you send with Wise, which you can use if you need to get in touch with them.

QA.question: What is a banking partner reference number?
QA.answer: A banking partner reference number is a number provided for some transfers, as Wise sends your money through local banking partners in each country.

QA.question: How do I use the banking partner reference number?
QA.answer: Give the banking partner reference number to your recipient. They can use it to see where the transfer is once it's completed on your Wise account and may need to provide it to their bank if they contact them.

QA.question: In India, what is a banking partner reference number sometimes called?
QA.answer: In India, banks sometimes call a banking partner reference number a UTR (Unique Transaction Reference) number or a transaction reference number.

QA.question: Why was I charged extra when using a card for the transfer?
QA.answer: There are three main reasons for being charged extra: 1) your bank charged an extra fee called a 'cash advance', 2) the card's currency is different from the sending currency, and 3) you've used a more expensive card like a credit or corporate card.

QA.question: What is a Merchant Category Code (MCC) and its role in extra charges?
QA.answer: A Merchant Category Code (MCC) is a number assigned by Wise to your payment, helping financial institutions categorize the payment type. The bank that issued your card can choose how to charge for it and might impose extra fees based on the MCC.

QA.question: How can I avoid extra charges when the card's currency is different from the sending currency?
QA.answer: To avoid extra charges, always pay with a card that uses the same currency as the currency you're sending from.

QA.question: Why might using a credit or corporate card result in extra charges?
QA.answer: In some countries, different cards have different fees on Wise, and generally, credit cards and corporate cards might be more expensive, resulting in extra charges.

QA.question: What should I do if my bank charges my transfer as a 'cash advance' or 'cash withdrawal'?
QA.answer: Call your bank and check how they charge for the MCC assigned to your payment. If they’ve charged it as a cash advance or cash withdrawal, ask them why and explain that the payment was not cash-related. They may be able to help.

QA.question: What should I do if I entered the wrong reference for a transfer?
QA.answer: If it's a personal transfer, wrong reference usually isn't a problem. However, if you're paying a company or need an accurate reference, cancel the transfer, and set it up again with the correct reference.

QA.question: How can I check the status of my transfer?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, go to Home, and find the transfer in your activity list. It should be marked as pending if not yet complete.

QA.question: When can I cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: You can cancel a transfer if it's set up, your money's on its way to us, or being processed.

QA.question: What should I do if I don't see the cancel button or the transfer is complete?
QA.answer: Contact the recipient, inform them about the wrong reference, and ask them to check with their bank whether the money can still be delivered or if it will be sent back to Wise.

QA.question: What happens if the bank sends my money back to Wise?
QA.answer: We'll contact you via email, and you can either set up a new transfer with the correct reference or cancel your transfer and get a refund.

QA.question: How can I fix a mistake if I sent money to the wrong person?
QA.answer: You can either cancel the transfer yourself if it's still pending, or contact the recipient and ask for the money back if the transfer is already complete.

QA.question: How can I check the status of my transfer?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, go to Home, and find your transfer in the activity list. The status should be marked as pending or complete.

QA.question: How do I cancel my transfer?
QA.answer: You can cancel your transfer if there's a cancel button on the transfer. Log in to your account and locate the pending transfer in your activity list.

QA.question: What should I do if my transfer is marked as complete but sent to the wrong person?
QA.answer: You should contact the recipient, explain the mistake, and ask them to send the money back to you.

QA.question: Can Wise cancel my transfer if it's out of the system?
QA.answer: No, if you can't cancel the transfer on Wise, it's out of the system. You'll need to contact your recipient directly.

QA.question: What happens if I send too much money for a transfer?
QA.answer: If you sent too much money, Wise will send the amount you wanted to your recipient and automatically refund the excess amount back to the bank account you paid from.

QA.question: Do I need to contact Wise for a refund if I overpaid?
QA.answer: No, you don't need to contact Wise for a refund. The system will automatically process the refund, and they will contact you if more information is needed.

QA.question: What if I sent not enough money for a transfer?
QA.answer: If you sent less money than required, your transfer will be paused. You can log in to Wise to pay the outstanding amount or wait for an email from Wise to guide you through the next steps.

QA.question: How can I fix a transfer if I didn't pay the full amount?
QA.answer: Log in to Wise, find the transfer in Activity, and pay the outstanding amount. Or, you can wait for an email from Wise that will guide you through the process of paying the outstanding amount.

QA.question: Will my transfer be completed if I haven't paid the full amount?
QA.answer: No, Wise will only complete your transfer once you've paid the full amount.

QA.question: Can I edit my transfer afterward?
QA.answer: No, the text does not provide information regarding editing transfers after they have been made.

QA.question: What do I do if I forgot the reference number?
QA.answer: Upload a proof of payment document and the company will be in touch to help identify your money.

QA.question: What is the unique reference number?
QA.answer: It is a number beginning with 'P' that you need to include with your bank transfer.

QA.question: How can I cancel my transfer?
QA.answer: The text does not provide information on cancelling transfers.

QA.question: How will the company contact me after I upload the proof of payment document?
QA.answer: The company will be in touch with you to help identify your money after you've uploaded the document.

QA.question: Can I cancel a completed transfer?
QA.answer: No, you can’t cancel a completed transfer. All transfers completed by Wise are final, and Wise can’t reverse or recall payments.

QA.question: How can I ensure the safety of my transfers with Wise?
QA.answer: Make sure you know and trust the person or business that you are sending to before setting up a transfer or sending any money.

QA.question: Will Wise get involved in disputes between senders and recipients?
QA.answer: Wise does not have the ability to be involved in disputes between senders and recipients.

QA.question: What happens if someone uses Wise to receive money fraudulently?
QA.answer: Wise will investigate any claims of fraud, and if someone is found to have used Wise fraudulently, they will be blocked from receiving money through the service.

QA.question: How can I cancel a transfer I haven't paid for?
QA.answer: Go to Home, find the pending transfer you want to cancel, click Cancel transfer, and then click I didn’t pay and Cancel transfer.

QA.question: Do I need to provide bank account details for a cancellation?
QA.answer: You only need to provide bank account details if you have already paid for the transfer and it was not paid using a credit or debit card.

QA.question: Can I cancel a transfer if my money is being processed?
QA.answer: You may be able to cancel by yourself if the Cancel transfer button is visible. If not, get in touch with customer support as soon as possible to cancel.

QA.question: What should I do if I made a mistake with the recipient's details?
QA.answer: Ask the recipient to contact their bank and reject the payment. The money will then be sent back to Wise, and it will be refunded to you.

QA.question: Can I cancel a transfer that is marked as complete?
QA.answer: No, once a transfer is marked as complete, it cannot be cancelled. You can ask the recipient to return the money to you.

QA.question: What happens if I don't pay for the transfer within 2 weeks?
QA.answer: If you don't pay for the transfer within 2 weeks, Wise will automatically cancel it.

QA.question: How long is the exchange rate guaranteed for?
QA.answer: The exchange rate is guaranteed for 24-48 hours, depending on the currency you send.

QA.question: What should I do if Wise asks for more information regarding my transfer?
QA.answer: If Wise asks for more information, you should provide the requested information within 2 working days to avoid automatic cancellation and refund of your transfer.

QA.question: What are the consequences of entering wrong recipient details during a transfer?
QA.answer: If you enter wrong recipient details, most banks won't accept the payment and the money will be sent back to Wise. You'll have the option to edit the details or cancel the transfer.

QA.question: What happens if I send money without setting up a transfer first?
QA.answer: If you send money without setting up a transfer, Wise will either add the money to your balance in the same currency (if you have one) or refund your money, informing you via email.

QA.question: How long do refunds take?
QA.answer: Refunds depend on the payment method, currency and the processing time of your bank.

QA.question: How long does it take for a bank transfer refund to appear back in my account?
QA.answer: A bank transfer refund takes between 0-3 working days to appear back in your account.

QA.question: How long does it take for a credit or debit card refund to go back into my account?
QA.answer: A credit or debit card refund can take up to 10 working days to go back into your account.

QA.question: Where can I find refund information for my specific currency?
QA.answer: Refund information for specific currencies can be found at the bottom of the page of the currency you paid with.

QA.question: Are refund times different for other payment types?
QA.answer: Yes, refund times may vary for other payment types. Please find the currency you paid with, and refund information will be at the bottom of the page.

QA.question: How do I set up a money transfer?
QA.answer: To set up a money transfer, you need to follow the instructions provided by the fintech company. Each company may have a different process for setting up transfers.

QA.question: Are there any fees for paying for a transfer?
QA.answer: The fees for paying for a transfer will depend on the fintech company and the type of transfer you are making.

QA.question: How can I edit or cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: To edit or cancel a transfer, follow the instructions provided by the fintech company. Each company may have different guidelines for editing and cancelling transfers.

QA.question: Can I get a refund for a cancelled transfer?
QA.answer: Yes, you can get a refund for a cancelled transfer. There is no fee for cancelling and refunding a transfer, and the full amount paid will be refunded.

QA.question: Are there any fees associated with cancelling and refunding a transfer?
QA.answer: No, there are no fees for cancelling and refunding a transfer. The full amount paid will be refunded, regardless of the type of transfer.

QA.question: How does Wise refund my money?
QA.answer: Wise automatically refunds your money to the bank account or card that you paid with, unless you paid with your Wise balance, in which case it will be refunded to the balance you paid with.

QA.question: Why is Wise asking for my refund account details?
QA.answer: Wise may ask for your refund account details if the details of the bank account you paid with aren't visible to them, if you've accidentally sent too much money, or if there's money left over after an amount lock transfer.

QA.question: Is it safe to provide my bank account details to Wise for a refund?
QA.answer: Yes, it is safe and secure to provide your bank account details to Wise for a refund.

QA.question: How do refunds work for bank accounts in Brazil?
QA.answer: Refunds to Brazilian bank accounts work slightly differently. You can learn more about the process on the Wise website.

QA.question: Will my money be refunded if I paid using my Wise balance?
QA.answer: Yes, if you paid using your Wise balance, your money will be refunded to the balance you paid with.

QA.question: How can I set up a transfer?
QA.answer: To set up a transfer, follow the instructions provided by your fintech company, usually involving providing recipient and payment details.

QA.question: How do I pay for a transfer?
QA.answer: Payment for a transfer can be made using methods accepted by your fintech company, such as bank transfers or debit/credit cards.

QA.question: Can I edit a transfer after setting it up?
QA.answer: The ability to edit a transfer varies by fintech company; check your account or contact customer support for assistance.

QA.question: How do I cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: To cancel a transfer, follow instructions provided by your fintech company or contact their customer support for assistance.

QA.question: Will my refund be sent to my Wise balance?
QA.answer: Wise refunds your money to the account you paid with. If you used your Wise balance to pay, you'll receive the refund there; otherwise, it'll be refunded to your original method of payment.

QA.question: Which currencies can I send money to and from?
QA.answer: You can send money to and from AUD, BGN, BRL, CAD, CHF, CZK, DKK, EUR, GBP, HKD, HUF, IDR, INR, JPY, MYR, NOK, NZD, PLN, RON, TRY, SEK, SGD, and USD. You can only send money to (via local transfer) AED, ARS, BDT, BWP, CLP, CNY, COP, CRC, EGP, FJD, GEL, GHS, ILS, KES, KRW, LKR, MAD, MXN, NPR, PHP, PKR, THB, UAH, UGX, UYU, VND, ZAR, and ZMW.

QA.question: Where can Wise send money?
QA.answer: Wise has a network of bank accounts globally in various countries, supporting members in all the currencies listed on the supported Wise countries page.

QA.question: How can I stay updated about new currency routes added by Wise?
QA.answer: You can visit the currency wishes page to stay informed about new routes, and also follow Wise on their Blog, Facebook, and Twitter.

QA.question: Are there any limitations on sending business payments in certain currencies?
QA.answer: Yes, currently, Wise is unable to send business payments to or from BRL, COP, PKR, and VND. They can only send payments to private recipients within those countries.

QA.question: In which countries is Wise able to receive USD?
QA.answer: Wise can receive USD via ACH bank debit, domestic wire, and international SWIFT payment.

QA.question: What countries can I send money to with Wise?
QA.answer: Argentina, Australia, Bangladesh, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Chile, China, Colombia, Costa Rica, Czech Republic, Denmark, Egypt, Europe, Georgia, Ghana, Hong Kong, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Israel, Japan, Kenya, Malaysia, Mexico, Morocco, Nepal, New Zealand, Norway, Pakistan, Philippines, Poland, Romania, Singapore, South Africa, South Korea, Sri Lanka, Sweden, Switzerland and Liechtenstein, Tanzania, Thailand, Turkey, Uganda, Ukraine, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States of America, Uruguay, Vietnam, and Zambia.

QA.question: Can I send business transfers with Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send business transfers to supported countries.

QA.question: What if the country I want to send money to is not on the list?
QA.answer: You might still be able to send money if the recipient's account is in USD, EUR, or GBP. Check the options for sending GBP, EUR, or USD to countries outside their native zones.

QA.question: Can I send EUR to countries outside the SEPA zone?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send EUR to countries outside the SEPA zone.

QA.question: How can I vote for a currency I'm interested in?
QA.answer: Visit the Wise website to submit your vote for the currency you're interested in.

QA.question: How does sending EUR to countries outside of SEPA work?
QA.answer: 1. Set up your transfer on Wise. 2. Add your recipient's account details. 3. Pay for your transfer. Wise sends the EUR to your recipient using the SWIFT payment network.

QA.question: What network does Wise use to send EUR to bank accounts outside of SEPA?
QA.answer: Wise uses the SWIFT payment network to send EUR to bank accounts outside of SEPA.

QA.question: How much does it cost to send EUR outside of SEPA?
QA.answer: There is an extra fee for sending money via SWIFT which is added to the regular Wise fee. Recipient's bank may also charge fees, and additional fees may be charged by intermediary banks handling the money.

QA.question: Are there any additional fees for recipients when sending EUR via SWIFT?
QA.answer: Yes, the recipient's bank might charge fees to receive payments sent with SWIFT, and they might also be charged by any banks that handle the money along the way.

QA.question: Where can I send EUR using SWIFT?
QA.answer: You can't send EUR to every country using SWIFT. Check where you can send EUR via SWIFT on Wise's website.

QA.question: Can I send GBP to bank accounts outside the UK?
QA.answer: Yes, with Wise, you can send British pounds (GBP) to bank accounts in countries outside of the UK, as long as the receiving bank account is denominated in GBP and has an IBAN.

QA.question: How does Wise send GBP to bank accounts outside of the UK?
QA.answer: Wise sends GBP to bank accounts outside of the UK using the SWIFT payment network.

QA.question: What are the steps to set up a transfer of GBP outside the UK?
QA.answer: 1. Set up your transfer on Wise. 2. Add the IBAN number of the recipient's bank account. 3. Pay for your transfer.

QA.question: Are there any additional fees for sending GBP outside the UK using Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, there's an additional fee for sending money by SWIFT which will be added to the regular Wise fee. Your recipient's bank may also charge fees to receive payments sent with SWIFT.

QA.question: Which countries can I send GBP to using Wise?
QA.answer: You can send GBP to SEPA countries, Albania, Andorra, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Bosnia and Herzegovina, British Virgin Islands, Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, Faroe Islands, Georgia, Greenland, Guatemala, Kazakhstan, Kuwait, Israel, Lebanon, Moldova, Montenegro, Mauritania, Mauritius, North Macedonia, Qatar, Saint Lucia, Serbia, Saudi Arabia, Seychelles, Sao Tome and Principe, Tunisia, Timor-Leste, Ukraine, and United Arab Emirates (UAE).

QA.question: What countries and currencies do you support?
QA.answer: You can send US dollars to bank accounts denominated in USD outside the US.

QA.question: How does sending USD to other countries work?
QA.answer: USD is sent to bank accounts outside the US via the SWIFT payment network, which may take a day or 2 longer and cost a bit more.

QA.question: How much does it cost to send USD to other countries?
QA.answer: When no correspondent fees are predicted, the sending fee is 2.90 USD; when fees are predicted, it's 14 USD, in addition to the SWIFT fee.

QA.question: Can I send money to an email address?
QA.answer: Transferring to an email address isn't supported yet. You need to add the account number and SWIFT code of the recipient's bank account.

QA.question: Can you send For Further Credit (FFC) payments?
QA.answer: No, we cannot send FFC payments as these transactions require a separate field for entering the actual final recipient, which we do not have.

QA.question: How do I pay for a transfer on Wise using a bank transfer?
QA.answer: 1. Set up your transfer on Wise. 2. Choose bank transfer at the payment step. 3. Leave your Wise account and pay through your bank, either online, over the phone, or in person. 4. Wait for confirmation from Wise.

QA.question: What should I double-check before making a bank transfer to Wise?
QA.answer: Ensure that the name on both bank and Wise accounts matches, you've included the reference correctly, and you enter the exact amount you're sending with Wise.

QA.question: Is there a faster way to make an online bank transfer from a UK bank to Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, you can choose the 'Log in and approve' option if it's available. Enter your online banking details, select the account to pay from, and click approve.

QA.question: When will I receive confirmation after making a bank transfer to Wise?
QA.answer: Wise will send you an email as soon as your money arrives in their bank account.

QA.question: What happens after my money arrives in Wise's bank account?
QA.answer: Wise will convert it and pay it out to your recipient.

QA.question: What happens if I didn’t include the reference number while paying by bank transfer?
QA.answer: If you didn't include the reference number, your transfer might be delayed while Wise tries to find your money. You'll need to upload a proof of payment document for assistance.

QA.question: What if I sent the wrong amount of money?
QA.answer: If you sent more than needed, Wise will refund the excess after completing the transfer. If you sent less than needed, Wise will pause the transfer and email you to ask what to do next.

QA.question: Can I send money from a different bank account than the one registered on Wise?
QA.answer: The name on the bank account from where the money is coming must match your name on Wise, except if you're paying from a joint account or through a Wise Business account.

QA.question: What should I do if my bank account name and Wise name don’t match?
QA.answer: If the names don't match, you'll need to cancel the transfer and set it up again, paying from your own account.

QA.question: What happens if I make a mistake with Wise's bank details?
QA.answer: If you enter incorrect bank details for Wise, the money will likely be rejected and returned to your account.

QA.question: Which cards are accepted to pay for a transfer?
QA.answer: We accept Visa, Mastercard, and some Maestro cards with a 16-digit card number, expiry date, and 3D security enabled. We don't accept American Express (AMEX) cards.

QA.question: Are there additional costs when paying with a credit or business card?
QA.answer: Yes, paying with a credit card or business card means you'll be charged a higher fee as it costs us more to process them. Your bank might also charge extra fees.

QA.question: Can I pay for my business transfers with a personal bank account?
QA.answer: No, you can’t pay for business payments from a personal bank account. Make sure to use your business card for Wise Business account transfers.

QA.question: What are the fees for international card payments?
QA.answer: When you pay with an international card, you'll be charged more fees due to higher processing costs. Your bank might also charge a fee to convert your money for you.

QA.question: How long does it take to refund a cancelled debit card payment?
QA.answer: Debit card refunds can take up to 10 working days to process but are usually back in your account in 2–5 working days.

QA.question: Why was my card payment declined?
QA.answer: A card payment can be declined for several reasons: declined by your bank, 3D Secure verification issue, browser issue, insufficient funds, or declined by Wise. Contact your bank to determine the cause and resolve the issue.

QA.question: Are there any restrictions on the cards I can use to make payments?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise currently does not accept payments from certain cards, including ones not in your name or your business' name, US-issued cards when the address is outside the US, cards from Argentina, China, Nigeria, Russia, Belarus, Singapore, UAE, AED currency cards, MYR transfers, Turkey, and American Express cards.

QA.question: What should I do if my debit or credit card payment fails due to 3D Secure verification issues?
QA.answer: First, try following browser solutions and make the payment again. If the problem persists, contact your bank to check if there’s an issue and to ensure your card is 3D Secure. If necessary, try making a bank transfer or use a different card.

QA.question: What should I do if my card payment gets declined due to insufficient funds?
QA.answer: Contact your bank to adjust your limits or verify the funds in your account. Meanwhile, try paying by bank transfer or set up a smaller transfer instead.

QA.question: How can I resolve the payment issues caused by my browser or antivirus software?
QA.answer: Make sure your antivirus software lists Wise as a 'safe merchant' and allows pop-ups. You can also try following browser solutions to resolve the issue.

QA.question: What are SWIFT payments?
QA.answer: SWIFT payments, also called international wires, are a type of international transfer sent via the SWIFT international payment network, one of the largest financial messaging systems in the world.

QA.question: What fees are associated with SWIFT payments?
QA.answer: Your bank may charge a fee for a SWIFT transfer, and correspondent banks in between may also deduct their handling fees.

QA.question: What is an 'OUR' SWIFT transfer?
QA.answer: An 'OUR' SWIFT transfer covers any fees associated with the payment, so that the receiver gets the full amount.

QA.question: How long do SWIFT payments take to reach their destination?
QA.answer: SWIFT payments usually take 2–5 working days but can take longer due to time differences or multiple intermediary banks.

QA.question: When does Wise pay out via SWIFT?
QA.answer: Wise pays out via SWIFT when sending USD to countries outside the US, GBP to countries outside the UK, or EUR to banks not part of SEPA and countries outside of SEPA.

QA.question: How can I pay for a transfer using Apple Pay or Google Pay?
QA.answer: 1. Open the Wise Android app for Google Pay or the iOS app or website on Safari for Apple Pay. 2. Set up a transfer as you usually would. 3. Select the Apple Pay or Google Pay option at the payment step. 4. Follow the steps to confirm the payment.

QA.question: What are the limits for sending money using Apple Pay?
QA.answer: Limits vary by country. For example, in the UK, the limit is 10,000 GBP, while in the US, it's 2,000 USD per day and 8,000 USD per week in a licensed state.

QA.question: What are the limits for sending money using Google Pay?
QA.answer: Limits vary by country. For instance, in the UK, the limit is 10,000 GBP, while in countries like Belgium, Estonia, and France, it's 2,000 EUR.

QA.question: Can I use Apple Pay or Google Pay if my bank card is issued in Japan?
QA.answer: No, we cannot accept bank cards issued in Japan for both Apple Pay and Google Pay.

QA.question: Do I need a specific Wise Android app version to use Google Pay?
QA.answer: Yes, you need version 3.13.1 or later of the Wise Android app to use Google Pay.

QA.question: What are the three types of transfers for sending GBP through Wise?
QA.answer: The three types of transfers are Low cost, Fast and easy, and Advanced.

QA.question: What is a Low cost transfer?
QA.answer: A Low cost transfer is an inexpensive method to send money that takes longer to pay for and requires a separate transaction using a manual bank transfer or money from your currency accounts.

QA.question: How does a Fast transfer work?
QA.answer: A Fast transfer is a convenient and quick method to send money by typing in your card details or using Apple Pay or Google Pay, which involves additional costs for processing your transaction and extra support for security.

QA.question: What is an Advanced transfer?
QA.answer: An Advanced transfer is used for sending money from a non-local GBP or EUR bank account, utilizing the SWIFT payment network and may involve an additional fee charged by your bank.

QA.question: Can I use Open Banking for Low cost transfers?
QA.answer: Yes, you can use Open Banking, a secure and convenient way to pay for GBP transfers, with Low cost transfers.

QA.question: What is Open Banking?
QA.answer: Open Banking is a secure and convenient way of topping up your Wise account or paying for your GBP transfer, initiated by the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) in 2017.

QA.question: How can I make a one-off Open Banking payment?
QA.answer: To make a one-off Open Banking payment, select 'Transfer the money from your bank account', choose the bank, click 'Continue' to pay, log in to your bank's website and complete 2-step verification, pick the account you'd like to pay from, and click to confirm.

QA.question: How do I connect my bank to Wise via Open Banking?
QA.answer: Choose 'Add Money' on your GBP Account, select 'Transfer the money from your bank account', pick the bank with an account you want to connect, set the connection limits, click 'Go to Bank', log in to your bank's website and complete 2-factor authentication, select the account you'd like to connect, and click to confirm.

QA.question: Can I cancel the connection between my bank and Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, you can cancel the connection in your Account Settings under 'Connected accounts'.

QA.question: What are the limits to paying by Open Banking?
QA.answer: Your bank will have a limit for sending a transfer online, generally varying between £10,000 - £50,000, with some banks having additional daily limits. Open Banking won't be available if the amount is higher than your bank's limit, but manual bank transfer will be guided instead.

QA.question: What are the 3 types of transfers for sending EUR?
QA.answer: The 3 types of transfers for sending EUR are Fast, Easy, and Low cost.

QA.question: What makes Fast transfers more expensive?
QA.answer: Fast transfers are more expensive due to extra work Wise needs to do to speed up the transaction and the extra security support when using cards, Apple Pay, or Google Pay.

QA.question: In which countries is the Easy transfer available?
QA.answer: Easy transfer is available in Austria, Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland.

QA.question: When should I use Low cost transfer?
QA.answer: Use Low cost transfer when you want the most from your money, and don't mind slightly slower funding and making a separate transaction.

QA.question: What payment methods can I use for an Easy transfer?
QA.answer: For an Easy transfer, you'll use SOFORT to send the money.

QA.question: What are the two types of transfers for sending European currencies?
QA.answer: Fast and easy transfers and Low cost transfers.

QA.question: Which currencies can I use Fast and easy or Low cost transfers for?
QA.answer: PLN, HUF, RON, BGN, CZK, SEK, NOK, and DKK.

QA.question: Why are Fast and easy transfers more expensive?
QA.answer: Fast and easy transfers require extra work to speed up processing and provide additional support to keep your money safe, making them more expensive.

QA.question: How can I pay for a Low cost transfer?
QA.answer: You can pay for a Low cost transfer using a manual bank transfer or by using the money in your balances.

QA.question: Do Low cost transfers take longer to process?
QA.answer: Manual bank transfers might be slightly harder to make and slower to reach us, as you'll need to send the money to Wise as a separate transaction.

QA.question: What is SEPA?
QA.answer: SEPA (Single Euro Payments Area) is a format for cross-border euro (EUR) bank transfers, aiming to make them equivalent to domestic transfers within your own country.

QA.question: Which countries are part of SEPA?
QA.answer: SEPA includes the Eurozone, countries within the EU, and a few other countries supporting EUR bank transfers. The full list can be found on the official SEPA website.

QA.question: How long does it take for my money to arrive to Wise after my bank sends a SEPA transfer?
QA.answer: Once your bank sends the SEPA transfer, your money should arrive to Wise within 1-2 working days.

QA.question: Are there any receiving fees for SEPA transfers?
QA.answer: There shouldn't be any receiving fees for SEPA transfers, but a very small number of banks may still charge for it. It is worth checking with the receiving bank if unsure.

QA.question: How long does it take for the recipient of a EUR transfer to receive the money?
QA.answer: The recipient of a EUR transfer should receive the money within 1-2 working days.

QA.question: What is the maximum payment allowed with iDeal?
QA.answer: The maximum payment is 50,000 EUR per transfer.

QA.question: How long does it take for an iDeal payment to be processed for transfers under 3,000 EUR?
QA.answer: For transfers under 3,000 EUR, it's instant.

QA.question: How long does it take for an iDeal payment to be processed for transfers over 3,000 EUR?
QA.answer: For transfers over 3,000 EUR, it takes 1 working day.

QA.question: How long does a refund take with iDeal?
QA.answer: The refund takes generally 2–3 working days (or a maximum of 10 working days).

QA.question: Is iDeal available on both the desktop version of the website and the app?
QA.answer: iDeal is available as a payment method on the desktop version of the website and on the app (Android only).

QA.question: What is Trustly and which countries and currencies does it support?
QA.answer: Trustly is a convenient payment method that works through your online banking. It supports bank accounts in Estonia and Finland (Eurozone), as well as Sweden and Denmark (outside Eurozone).

QA.question: Can I use Trustly to make payments from my business account?
QA.answer: No, Trustly doesn't support payments from businesses. Use a different payment method like card or bank transfer instead.

QA.question: How much does it cost to use Trustly for my Wise transfer?
QA.answer: You can find information on how much each payment method costs on Wise's pricing page.

QA.question: How long does it take for Trustly payments to process?
QA.answer: Usually, it takes between 0–2 working days. The time it takes often depends on the bank you're sending from.

QA.question: What are the maximum limits for sending money with Trustly?
QA.answer: You can send up to 1.2 million EUR, 8.5 million DKK, or 12.5 million SEK. However, your bank may have its own limits on how much you can send at a time.

QA.question: In which countries is SOFORT available?
QA.answer: SOFORT is available for selected banks in Austria, Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Slovakia, Spain, and Switzerland.

QA.question: How much does it cost to use SOFORT?
QA.answer: You can find information on how much each payment method costs on our pricing page.

QA.question: How long does it take for a SOFORT transfer to arrive?
QA.answer: SOFORT transfers usually take between 0–4 working days to arrive.

QA.question: What is the maximum amount I can send using SOFORT?
QA.answer: You can send up to 25,000 EUR every 24 hours by SOFORT.

QA.question: How do I pay with SOFORT?
QA.answer: 1. Set up a transfer as you normally would. 2. At the payment step, choose to pay with SOFORT. 3. You’ll be directed to the SOFORT website, where you’ll need to enter details about your bank and securely confirm the payment. Make sure you have enough money in your account before you confirm.

QA.question: How long does it take for money to reach Wise when I pay through a connected bank account (ACH) in the US?
QA.answer: It usually takes up to 4 working days for your money to reach Wise and 2-3 working days for the debit to appear in your bank account.

QA.question: How can I secure the guaranteed rate when paying with a connected bank account (ACH)?
QA.answer: The guaranteed rate is secured once you have authorised the payment to Wise.

QA.question: What is the maximum amount I can send with a connected bank account (ACH)?
QA.answer: You can send up to 50,000 USD per 24 hours, up to 250,000 USD over a 60-day period for personal accounts, and up to 400,000 USD for business accounts.

QA.question: Do I need to provide my Social Security number (SSN) for a connected bank account (ACH)?
QA.answer: We might ask for your SSN depending on a number of factors, but no one in Wise has access to it. You might be able to get verified with another form of US ID if you don't have an SSN.

QA.question: What happens if I cancel my debit from the connected bank account (ACH)?
QA.answer: You can cancel for a full refund up to 30 minutes after payment, unless the money has already been paid out. If it has left your bank account, please wait for our refund.

QA.question: How does microdeposits verification work?
QA.answer: We'll send two small amounts (between 0.01-0.99 USD) to your account, which will appear on your bank statement in up to 2 business days. You'll then need to enter the amounts on Wise to verify your account.

QA.question: How do I enter the amounts of the microdeposits?
QA.answer: Once you see the microdeposits in your account, enter the amounts on your transfer page, or go to your profile > Settings > Connected accounts > Complete verification > Continue, and enter the amount.

QA.question: Will I have to do microdeposits verification every time I send money?
QA.answer: If you have 2-step verification enabled, you won't need to verify again for old or new recipients. If not enabled, you'll have to verify your account each time you send to a new recipient.

QA.question: Can I use microdeposits verification on the mobile app?
QA.answer: No, you can only do this on the website.

QA.question: What is the purpose of microdeposits verification?
QA.answer: Microdeposits verification is used to confirm that your bank account belongs to you when making a transfer from the US with an ACH bank debit.

QA.question: Can I pay by ACH electronic payment?
QA.answer: Yes, but ACH Debit is easier and safer. If necessary, use routing number 026073150 for electronic payments if in a state where Wise partners are present.

QA.question: How can I check if my payment is a wire or electronic?
QA.answer: You can check with your bank to determine the type of payment and avoid delays or incorrect information.

QA.question: How long does it take for my money to reach Wise when paying by direct debit in Canada?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days for the money to leave your account, and then 3-4 working days for it to reach us.

QA.question: What is the maximum amount I can send via direct debit in Canada?
QA.answer: You can send up to 9,500 CAD every 24 hours, and up to 30,000 CAD every week.

QA.question: Is the guaranteed rate secured when I pay for a transfer with direct debit?
QA.answer: The guaranteed rate is secured once you have authorized the payment to Wise.

QA.question: Can I pay by direct debit from my business account?
QA.answer: Yes, if you have a business account, you can pay via direct debit using your business bank account.

QA.question: Can I send an out of band payment?
QA.answer: Wise can't accept out of band payments. You can only initiate a direct debit within the Wise website or app.

QA.question: How long does an OBT take to arrive to Wise?
QA.answer: An OBT can take 1-3 working days to arrive to Wise.

QA.question: What banks and credit unions in Canada work with Wise for online bill pay?
QA.answer: Bank of Montreal, National Bank of Canada, Central 1 Credit Unions, EQ Bank, CS Alterna Bank, Manulife Bank of Canada, and First Calgary Financial.

QA.question: What is the payee province and payee name for Wise when adding it as a bill payee?
QA.answer: The payee province is ON (Ontario), and the payee name is Wise or TransferWise.

QA.question: What should I use as the account number when adding Wise as a bill payee?
QA.answer: Use your Wise membership number (starts with a P, no spaces or dashes).

QA.question: How can I send bill payments through Central 1 Credit Union?
QA.answer: Set the transfer up as a wire with Wise, and choose Wise as a bill payee in your online banking to send the bill payment.

QA.question: What is POLi and how can I use it for my transfers?
QA.answer: POLi is a payment method that allows you to send money through Wise using your online banking. You can use POLi if you have an account with one of the supported Australian or New Zealand banks.

QA.question: Which Australian banks support POLi payments with Wise?
QA.answer: The supported Australian banks are ANZ, Bank of Queensland (BOQ), Bankwest, Bendigo Bank, Citibank, Commonwealth Bank, Great Southern Bank (CUA), IMB Building Society, ME Bank, NAB, Newcastle Permanent, and People's Choice Credit Union.

QA.question: Can I use POLi if I have a bank account in New Zealand?
QA.answer: Yes, POLi is available for the following New Zealand banks: ANZ, ASB, Bank of New Zealand, Kiwibank, TSB Bank, and Westpac.

QA.question: How do I set up a transfer using the POLi payment method?
QA.answer: To set up a transfer using POLi, choose POLi as your payment method when setting up a transfer in Wise, and authorize the payment through your supported online banking platform.

QA.question: Can I edit or cancel a transfer paid with POLi?
QA.answer: Yes, to edit or cancel a transfer paid with POLi, follow the same process as for other payment methods within Wise, keeping in mind that some fees or restrictions may apply.

QA.question: Can I send educational transfers from BRL?
QA.answer: No, you can't send educational transfers from BRL right now.

QA.question: What actions can be taken with transfers?
QA.answer: You can set up, pay for, edit, and cancel transfers.

QA.question: Is PayPal available for Wise business accounts?
QA.answer: Unfortunately, PayPal is not available for businesses yet.

QA.question: Can I make PayPal payments in currencies other than EUR?
QA.answer: For now, we can only accept payments from PayPal wallets denominated in EUR.

QA.question: How much can I send with PayPal on Wise?
QA.answer: You can send up to three transfers of up to 2,500 EUR per transfer, 3 times per day via PayPal.

QA.question: How long does it take for Wise to receive my PayPal payment?
QA.answer: We should receive your payment instantly.

QA.question: What should I do if I don’t have enough money in my PayPal wallet when starting the payment on Wise?
QA.answer: If you don’t have enough money in your PayPal wallet, the payment will fail. If your PayPal wallet is linked to an external bank account, PayPal may collect the money via a Direct Debit.

QA.question: How long does verification take for both personal and business customers?
QA.answer: Verification usually takes 5-14 working days for both personal and business customers.

QA.question: What happens after my transfer is successfully verified?
QA.answer: Once you or your business is successfully verified, your transfer will automatically resume and you will be notified via email.

QA.question: What should I do if Wise requires more information to finish my verification?
QA.answer: If Wise needs more information, they will send you an email. Be sure to check your emails, including your spam folder, and provide the requested information to avoid transfer delays.

QA.question: How can I check the status of my transfer?
QA.answer: To check the status of your transfer, follow the instructions provided by Wise.

QA.question: How do I get my Wise Business account verified?
QA.answer: To get your Wise Business account verified, follow the instructions provided by Wise on their verification process.

QA.question: How do I set up a transfer?
QA.answer: You can set up a transfer by providing the required information, such as recipient's name, account number, and bank name.

QA.question: How do I pay for a transfer?
QA.answer: You can pay for a transfer using your bank account.

QA.question: Can I edit a transfer after setting it up?
QA.answer: Yes, you can edit the transfer details before it is processed.

QA.question: How can I cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: You can cancel a transfer before it is processed by contacting customer support.

QA.question: What information is required to verify my joint account?
QA.answer: To verify your joint account, please upload a bank statement showing first and last names of both account holders, account number, and bank name.

QA.question: How long do additional checks on my transfer take?
QA.answer: Additional checks on your transfer usually take 2–10 working days.

QA.question: Why do you need to perform additional checks on transfers?
QA.answer: Wise performs these checks to keep your money safe, as it is a regulated financial institution.

QA.question: Will you update the delivery estimate if there are additional checks?
QA.answer: Yes, we usually update the delivery estimate to take the additional checks into account.

QA.question: How will I know if you need extra information from me?
QA.answer: We will get in touch with you via email if we need any extra information. Check your email and spam inbox for messages from us.

QA.question: Where can I check my transfer progress?
QA.answer: You can check your transfer progress in the Activity section of your Wise account.

QA.question: Can I get my documents approved before I send a transfer?
QA.answer: We can't approve your documents before you send a transfer, as we review transfers on a case by case basis.

QA.question: What documents might be needed for a transfer?
QA.answer: The required documents may vary, but you can see the list of documents we accept and learn more about sending your documents on our website.

QA.question: Can you advise me on what documents you think you might need?
QA.answer: Yes, get in touch and we'll do our best to prepare you for your transfer based on the information we have.

QA.question: How do I edit or cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: You can edit or cancel a transfer in the account settings on our website or mobile app.

QA.question: What should I do if I need help with setting up or paying for a transfer?
QA.answer: Contact our customer support for assistance with setting up or paying for a transfer.

QA.question: How do I make a scheduled transfer?
QA.answer: 1. Select 'Send money'. 2. Confirm where you're sending from. 3. Enter the amount you'd like to send. 4. Select the calendar icon next to 'Continue'. 5. Choose the date you'd like us to send your money. 6. Choose the frequency. 7. Select 'Confirm'.

QA.question: Can I edit a scheduled transfer?
QA.answer: No, you can't change the details of a scheduled transfer. You'll need to cancel the transfer and set up a new one with the correct details.

QA.question: How long does it take for my recipient to receive the money after a scheduled transfer is sent?
QA.answer: Your recipient should get the money within 3 days from the scheduled date.

QA.question: When can I cancel my scheduled transfer?
QA.answer: You can cancel your transfer up to 23:59 the day before your transfer is scheduled.

QA.question: Will I get a guaranteed rate for a scheduled transfer?
QA.answer: No, you won't get a guaranteed rate. Your transfer will be sent on the morning of the scheduled date, using the current mid-market rate at the time.

QA.question: How can I send money from a Wise balance?
QA.answer: You can either go to your balance and send money from there, or make a transfer as usual and choose to send from your balance at the payment step.

QA.question: How do I add money to my Wise balance?
QA.answer: Before sending money from your balance, you need to open a balance and add money to it. You can find instructions on how to do that on the Wise website or app.

QA.question: Is sending money from a Wise balance faster than sending from a bank account outside Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, sending money from your Wise balance is faster than sending from a bank account outside of Wise.

QA.question: Are the fees different when sending money from a Wise balance?
QA.answer: For transfers over 1,000 GBP or equivalent in other currencies, the fees are lower when sending money from your Wise balance.

QA.question: In which currencies are Direct Debits available?
QA.answer: Direct Debits are available for AUD, CAD, EUR, GBP, and USD account details.

QA.question: How can I set up a Direct Debit with Wise?
QA.answer: You can learn how to set up a Direct Debit on the Wise website or app.

QA.question: What should I do if I've forgotten my Wise password?
QA.answer: If you’ve forgotten your password, follow the instructions for resetting your password on the Wise website or app.

QA.question: Is it free to send money from my Wise account to someone else's balance of the same currency?
QA.answer: Yes, it's free to send money from your account to someone else's balance of the same currency.

QA.question: Are there any fees for sending money from my Wise account to a bank account outside of Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, a fixed fee will be charged if you're sending money from your Wise account to a bank account outside of Wise.

QA.question: Are there any conversion fees while sending money to a different currency?
QA.answer: Yes, a conversion fee will be charged if you send money to a different currency.

QA.question: How can I check the exact fee for sending money?
QA.answer: To check the fee, use the pricing page on Wise's website. Type in the amount and choose the currency you're sending from and to, and the exact fee will be displayed.

QA.question: Are there any higher fees for sending USD, EUR, or GBP to countries outside of the US, SEPA Zone, or the UK?
QA.answer: Yes, there will be a higher fee for sending USD, EUR, or GBP to countries outside of the US, SEPA Zone, or the UK.

QA.question: Is it safe to send large amounts with Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise follows strict security measures to ensure your money and data are always safe and protected, including being regulated by the FCA and other global regulators.

QA.question: How does Wise safeguard my money?
QA.answer: Wise safeguards your money by holding it in dedicated bank accounts or high-quality liquid assets, maintaining the value of assets in separate accounts with financial institutions.

QA.question: What is 2-step verification and how can I set it up?
QA.answer: 2-step verification adds an extra layer of security to your account by asking you to verify your identity every time you log in or make a transfer, through methods like text message, fingerprint, or face recognition. Learn how to set up your 2-step verification on Wise's website.

QA.question: How does Wise protect customers from fraud?
QA.answer: Wise has a dedicated anti-fraud team that works to protect customers, their money, and data from fraudulent activities.

QA.question: Who can I contact if I have questions or concerns about sending large amounts with Wise?
QA.answer: Wise has a support team dedicated to helping customers send large amounts. You can get in touch with them through Wise's website for any questions or concerns.

QA.question: What documents might be needed for a large transfer?

QA.question: How much does it cost to send large transfers?

QA.question: How do the fees work for sending large amounts?
QA.answer: When you send over 100,000 GBP (or equivalent in your currency) over a calendar month, you’ll get a lower fee on the amount you send over the limit. The discount applies on one-time transfers or multiple completed transfers in the same month and only when a conversion happens.

QA.question: Does the discount apply if I send transfers in the same currency?
QA.answer: No, it would not apply if you are sending transfers to the same currencies (i.e. USD to USD externally or USD to your Wise USD currency account).

QA.question: How much is the fee and how is it calculated?
QA.answer: The fee is determined by the monthly volume that you send. The more you send, the lower your fee is. It works like tax brackets and is automatically applied to your transfer.

QA.question: What if I send multiple transfers in a month?
QA.answer: The lower fee applies on one-time transfers or multiple completed transfers in the same month, as long as the initial limits for each bracket have been met.

QA.question: Do I need to manually calculate the fee?
QA.answer: No, you don’t need to work the fee out yourself. We’ll always automatically apply it to your transfer.

QA.answer: A transfer needs to be completed — that is, sent out to the recipient — before it'll count towards your threshold.

QA.question: How do I add a new recipient?
QA.answer: Go to Recipients, then select Add your bank account for your own account or Add a recipient for someone else's account. Fill in the details or find your friend using their email address. Finally, select Confirm to save your recipient.

QA.question: Can I edit the recipient's information?
QA.answer: No, you cannot edit a saved recipient. To make a change, you need to delete them as a recipient and add them again.

QA.question: What happens if the person doesn't accept the email transfer within 1 week?
QA.answer: If the recipient doesn't accept the email transfer within 1 week, your money will be refunded back to the bank account it came from.

QA.question: How can I mark a primary account to receive money into?

QA.question: How can I fix a mistake in my recipient's bank details?
QA.answer: You can fix this mistake by cancelling the transfer and setting up a new transfer with the correct bank details. First, check the status of your transfer by logging into your Wise account and going to the activity list. If your transfer is still pending, follow the steps to cancel your transfer. If your transfer is marked as complete, contact your recipient to inform them of the mistake and ask them to contact their bank regarding the issue.

QA.question: Can I cancel my transfer if it's still pending?
QA.answer: Yes, you can cancel your transfer if it's still pending. You can do this if your transfer is set up, your money is on its way to Wise, or your money is being processed.

QA.question: How do I cancel a pending transfer?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, go to the Home to see your activity list. Find the pending transfer, and there should be an option to cancel it. Follow the instructions to complete the cancellation process.

QA.question: What should I do if I can't cancel a completed transfer?
QA.answer: If your transfer is marked as complete and you can't cancel it, contact your recipient. Tell them about the mistake in their bank details and ask them to contact their bank. The bank may be able to deliver the money or send it back to Wise.

QA.question: What happens if the bank sends my money back to Wise?
QA.answer: If the bank sends your money back to Wise, Wise will contact you via email. You can then choose to set up a new transfer with the correct bank details or cancel the transfer and get a refund.

QA.question: How long does it take to get a refund?
QA.answer: The refund time depends on various factors, such as the banks and countries involved. To learn more about refund times for your specific situation, refer to the Wise support documentation or contact their customer support.

QA.question: How can I fix my recipient's name if I spelled it wrong?
QA.answer: You can fix this by cancelling the transfer and setting up a new one with the correct name. Check the status of your transfer first, and if it's still pending, you can cancel it. If the transfer is complete, you'll need to contact your recipient and ask them to contact their bank.

QA.question: How can I cancel a transfer?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, go to 'Home' to see your activity list, and find the transfer marked as pending. Learn how to cancel your transfer if it's set up, your money's on its way to Wise, or your money's being processed.

QA.question: What should I do if my transfer is complete but the recipient's name is wrong?
QA.answer: Contact the person you're paying, tell them that their name is incorrect, and ask them to contact their bank to find out whether the money can be delivered or if the bank will send it back to Wise.

QA.question: What happens if the recipient's bank sends the money back to Wise?
QA.answer: Wise will contact you via email. You can then choose to set up your transfer with the correct name or cancel your transfer and get a refund.

QA.question: What should I do if the recipient's bank asks for a name amendment letter?
QA.answer: Wise cannot provide a name amendment letter. Instead, ask the recipient to contact their bank and tell them to reject the payment. Their bank will then send the money back to Wise. Once received, Wise will contact you via email, allowing you to set up a correct transfer or receive a refund.

QA.question: What happens if I enter my recipient's email incorrectly when sending money to their bank account?
QA.answer: Using the wrong email address won't stop your money from being delivered. However, your recipient won't receive emails from Wise, such as transfer confirmations. You can inform your recipient that you've sent the money, but they won't get the email confirmation.

QA.question: Can I cancel my transfer if I entered my recipient's email incorrectly?
QA.answer: You can cancel your transfer if it is marked as pending, set up, your money is on its way to Wise, or your money is being processed. If your transfer is complete, it means it's already in the banking system and cannot be cancelled.

QA.answer: Learn how to cancel your transfer on the Wise website or in the Wise app.

QA.answer: You can send money to email addresses on the Wise website by checking the box confirming that you don’t know your recipient's bank details.

QA.question: How is the cost of a transfer calculated?
QA.answer: The cost of a transfer depends on the amount you're sending, how you pay, and the exchange rate.

QA.question: Does Wise charge a percentage fee?
QA.answer: Yes, the Wise fee is worked out as a percentage of the amount you're sending which varies from currency to currency.

QA.answer: Yes, there's a cheap, minimum fee for sending small amounts of money.

QA.answer: You can check the latest fees on our pricing page.

QA.question: What exchange rate does Wise use?
QA.answer: Wise uses the mid-market rate, which is the one banks use to trade between themselves, and never marks up the rate.

QA.question: Can I lock in the exchange rate when setting up my transfer?
QA.answer: For some currencies, you can lock in the rate you see during the transfer setup, as long as the total amount is received in the stated timeframe (normally 24 or 48 hours).

QA.question: Do payment methods influence the cost of a transfer?
QA.answer: Yes, there are different ways to pay depending on the country you're sending from, and the payment method or type of transfer will affect the cost.

QA.question: What is a guaranteed rate?
QA.answer: A guaranteed rate is an exchange rate that's guaranteed for a specified period of time. We offer guaranteed rates for all of our transfers.

QA.question: How long is the rate guaranteed on my transfer?
QA.answer: The guarantee period depends on the currency you're sending from. We'll always tell you how long the rate is guaranteed for when you set your transfer up.

QA.question: What happens if the rate changes by 5% or more during the guaranteed rate period?
QA.answer: If the rate changes by 5% or more during the guaranteed rate period, we may cancel and refund your transfer. We'll send the money back to the account it came from.

QA.question: What if my transfer falls on a weekend?
QA.answer: In most countries, banks don't process transfers over the weekend. If your transfer has a 48-hour guaranteed rate and you set up your transfer on Friday, at 5:00pm, your rate will be guaranteed until Tuesday at 5:00 pm.

QA.question: What rate do I get if I set up a transfer on the weekend?
QA.answer: If you set up a transfer on a weekend, you'll get the last rate before the market closed on the Friday.

QA.question: How many transfers can I set up with a guaranteed rate?
QA.answer: You can't set up an unlimited number of transfers with a guaranteed rate. We'll limit the number of guaranteed rate transfers you can make if we notice you're setting up multiple ones to get the best rate.

QA.question: What happens if I don't pay by bank transfer?
QA.answer: If you chose a payment method other than bank transfer, your rate is locked when you've successfully paid. If you paid for your transfer from USD using ACH bank debit, we'll lock your rate when you confirm the payment on Wise.

QA.question: What happens if I miss my guaranteed rate lock?
QA.answer: If your money reaches us after your guaranteed rate lock has expired, we’ll use the live rate at the time we receive it.

QA.question: How can I ensure I get the rate I've locked?
QA.answer: To make sure you always get the rate you’ve locked, it’s best to get your money to us as soon as possible and read our tips on sending money with your bank.

QA.question: Do banks have limits on the amount I can send online?
QA.answer: Yes, it’s common for banks to have limits on the amount you can send online.

QA.question: How does Wise handle missing the guaranteed rate due to bank limits?
QA.answer: We'll lock the live rate at the time your money reaches our account if your rate lock expires before we receive the funds.

QA.question: How can I set up a transfer?
QA.answer: Setting up a transfer can be done through the platform provided by the fintech company. Simply follow the instructions to enter the necessary information, select the desired currency, and complete the payment.

QA.question: What are the fees for transferring money?
QA.answer: Fees for transferring money vary depending on the currencies involved and the specific fintech company's pricing policy. Please refer to their website or contact their customer support for details.

QA.question: Can I edit or cancel a transfer after it has been initiated?
QA.answer: In most cases, transfers can be edited or cancelled before they are fully processed. You should contact the fintech company's customer support for assistance.

QA.question: Is it possible to receive rate alerts?
QA.answer: Yes, you can set up rate alerts to be notified when the exchange rate reaches a specific level. You can also request a daily email about rates between available currencies.

QA.question: How do I set up a rate alert?
QA.answer: You can set up a rate alert by accessing the fintech company's platform and specifying the desired exchange rate. The system will notify you when the rate reaches the level you've set.

QA.question: What are the two types of exchange rates for my transfer?
QA.answer: The two types of exchange rates are a live rate and a guaranteed rate.

QA.question: What does a live rate mean for my transfer?
QA.answer: A live rate means that your transfer will be converted using the rate that's live at the time your money gets to Wise. You won't know exactly how much your recipient will get, because the rate will change in the time it takes your money to reach Wise from your bank account.

QA.question: How can I know if I've got a live rate for my transfer?
QA.answer: You can tell if your transfer is using the live rate if you see a message saying the exchange rate isn't guaranteed when you set up your transfer.

QA.question: Why can't Wise offer me a guaranteed rate sometimes?
QA.answer: Wise can't offer you a guaranteed rate if the exchange rate is really volatile.

QA.question: Can I send an exact amount while the exchange rate isn't guaranteed?
QA.answer: If there's no guaranteed rate, you won't be able to send an exact amount using the 'Recipient gets' box. However, you can still send an exact amount by opening a balance in the currencies, adding money to your balance, converting that money, and sending it to your recipient.

QA.question: What are the steps to send an exact amount when the exchange rate isn't guaranteed?
QA.answer: 1. Open a balance in the currency you have and the currency you want your recipient to get. 2. Add money to your balance in the currency you have. 3. Convert that money to the currency you want your recipient to get. 4. Send the money straight from that currency to your recipient.

QA.question: What can I do with a Wise account?
QA.answer: With a Wise account, you can hold 50+ currencies, convert currencies instantly with low fees, get account details to receive money in various currencies, set up Direct Debits, order a Wise card, spend on the debit card in any currency with low fees, and set aside money in any currency with Wise Jars.
