It usually takes 3-4 days for the merchant to claim the money from your account, at which point the transaction will change from pending to completed.

QA.question: How long does it take for a pending transaction to be completed?
QA.answer: It usually takes 3-4 days for the merchant to claim the money from your account, and then the pending transaction will be completed.

QA.question: What happens if a payment is pending for more than 4 days?
QA.answer: Sometimes it takes longer for the merchant to claim the money from your account. You do not need to do anything; just wait for the transaction to go through. If the merchant doesn't claim the funds, the money will be released back into your account in up to 30 days.

QA.question: I cancelled a payment, but it still shows as pending. Why?
QA.answer: This might happen because of problems with the payment terminal or an internet connection. The money will be released back into your account in 15 days for most payments or up to 30 days for some payments like booking deposits, car rental services, or hotel reservations.

QA.question: Can Wise stop a pending transaction from going through?
QA.answer: If a transaction is pending, Wise can’t stop the merchant from claiming the money. To cancel the transaction, you'll need to contact the merchant.

QA.question: What is pre-authorisation?
QA.answer: Pre-authorisation is used by businesses like hotels, gas stations, or car rental companies. It acts like a reservation that will change to the correct amount once the business knows how much you’re actually going to spend.

QA.question: What is a pre-authorised transaction?
QA.answer: A pre-authorised transaction acts like a reservation, charged by businesses such as hotels, gas stations, or car rentals, that will change to the correct amount once the business knows how much you’re actually going to spend.

QA.question: How does a pre-authorised transaction work?
QA.answer: For example, you use your Wise card at a gas station; you'll see a charge of 50 USD, but if it only costs 30 USD, the charge changes to 30 USD after a few days, and the transaction status changes from pre-authorised to spent.

QA.question: How long should I wait for the pre-authorised transaction to change to the correct amount?
QA.answer: Businesses usually reverse a pre-authorised transaction and charge the correct amount within one day, but it can sometimes take up to 30 days.

QA.question: What should I do if the pre-authorised transaction hasn't changed to the correct amount after 30 days?
QA.answer: Get in touch with Wise, fill in their dispute form, and send them the receipt showing the correct amount.

QA.question: Is the Wise card available for people outside the UK, US, Switzerland, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, Japan, Canada, Brazil, and most of the EEA?
QA.answer: We can’t issue the card to people who don’t live in these countries.

QA.question: How do I get a Wise card?
QA.answer: 1. Get a Wise account. 2. Order your Wise card. 3. Activate your Wise card.

QA.question: Do I need to verify my account to get a Wise card?
QA.answer: Yes, we need to verify your account before issuing the card.

QA.question: Is there a fee for ordering a Wise card?
QA.answer: In most cases, we'll ask you to pay a small fee for the card. In some cases, you will only need to add money to your balance.

QA.question: Can I use my Wise card for online and mobile wallet purchases before it is delivered?
QA.answer: Yes, if you ordered your card in the EEA, the UK, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Japan, Brazil, or Canada, you can check your card details and use them for online purchases and mobile wallet purchases before your card is delivered.

QA.question: How do I activate my US Mastercard Wise card?
QA.answer: You can activate it by entering the 6-digit code found underneath your name on the front of your card. Enter it on the activation page.

QA.question: What ATM providers can I use my Wise card with while in Japan?
QA.answer: You may only be able to use it at AEON, E-net, and Daily Yamazaki ATM providers.

QA.question: How do I get a Wise digital card for my personal account?
QA.answer: You can get a digital card if you already have a physical card and live in the UK, Australia, Japan, New Zealand, Singapore, Malaysia, Switzerland, Canada, Brazil, or EEA. Unfortunately, if you live in the US, you won't be able to get a digital card.

QA.question: Can I get a Wise digital card for my business account?
QA.answer: Your business can get a digital card if it already has a physical one and is registered in the UK, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Switzerland, Canada, or EEA. For US businesses without multiple shareholders, you can get a digital card but not a physical one. If your US business has multiple shareholders, Wise currently cannot offer any card.

QA.question: Are there any limitations on getting a digital card for businesses in Japan?
QA.answer: Yes, if your business is in Japan, you won't be able to get a digital card.

QA.question: How many digital cards can each user of a business get?
QA.answer: Each user of a business can get up to 3 digital cards.

QA.question: How do I order a digital card using the Wise app?
QA.answer: 1. Go to your Wise account. 2. Tap on Card. 3. Swipe your cards to the right on the app until you get to the Get your digital card section. 4. Select Get your digital card.

QA.question: How do I order a digital card using the Wise website?
QA.answer: 1. Go to your Wise account. 2. Click on Cards. 3. Click on Order a card. 4. On the new screen, click on Get yours now.

QA.question: How long does it take for my new digital card to be ready for use?
QA.answer: Once you've requested your new digital card, it's ready to be used immediately.

QA.question: Can I add my Wise digital card to mobile wallets?
QA.answer: Yes, you can add your digital cards to mobile wallets like Apple Pay and Google Pay.

QA.question: Can I get the Wise card in my country?
QA.answer: The Wise card is available for residents of specific countries and regions who have a Wise account. It is available in most European countries, Singapore, Malaysia, Japan, Australia, New Zealand, Canada, the US (except Nevada), and Brazil.

QA.question: How long will it take for me to receive my card?
QA.answer: Delivery times depend on your country or region. Generally, it takes 2-6 days in the UK, 14-21 working days in the US, 7-14 working days in Australia, 5-7 working days in Brazil, and within 14 working days in Canada and the EEA.

QA.question: What if my country isn't listed for the Wise card availability?
QA.answer: If your country or region isn't on the list, join the waitlist, and Wise will notify you when cards become available in your area.

QA.question: Is the Wise card available for residents in Nevada?
QA.answer: No, the Wise card is currently not available for residents in Nevada.

QA.question: How fast is the card delivery in Singapore?
QA.answer: In Singapore, delivery usually takes around 3 working days.

QA.question: Can I speed up my card order?
QA.answer: Yes, you can speed up your card order if you ordered it in the UK, EEA, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Malaysia, or Japan. In Singapore, you can speed up the card order if the delivery address is outside Singapore. However, for the US, you don't have the option to speed up your card order.

QA.question: How do I request expedited delivery?
QA.answer: You have to request the expedited delivery method when you request the card. Once the order is placed, it's not possible to expedite it.

QA.question: How long does expedited delivery take?
QA.answer: Expedited delivery by DHL, will deliver your card to you in person within 2 working days after it's produced.

QA.question: What happens if I'm not at the delivery address to collect my card?
QA.answer: DHL will try again one more time. If you're not around on the second try, DHL will send the card back to us and we'll destroy it. A refund for the cost of delivery cannot be offered in this case.

QA.question: How much does expedited delivery cost?
QA.answer: The cost depends on where your card is being sent to. You will see the additional fee for expedited delivery when you order the card.

QA.question: Will I get a tracking number for expedited delivery?
QA.answer: Yes, you'll get a tracking number by email if you choose to speed up your card order. You can track your card on DHL's website.

QA.question: Can I change my delivery address or schedule it?
QA.answer: No, you can't change your delivery address once you've placed a card order. Please cancel your card order and place a new one.

QA.question: How do I activate my Wise card?
QA.answer: For most customers, you simply need to make your first Chip and PIN payment. If declined, use the card at an ATM for cash withdrawal or balance enquiry.

QA.question: What should I do if I'm trying to activate my Wise card in Canada?
QA.answer: You won't be able to make a cash withdrawal at local ATMs. Choose Balance Inquiry at an ATM to activate your card.

QA.question: How do I activate my Wise card if I'm a cardholder in Japan?
QA.answer: If your card was issued after the 27th of March 2023, use the 6-digit PIN we give you and follow these steps: 1) Go to your Wise account. 2) Go to Card. 3) Choose Activate Now. 4) Enter the 6-digit code.

QA.question: What if my Wise card was issued in Japan before the 27th of March 2023?
QA.answer: You can activate the card by entering your 4-digit pin when checking your balance from any of these 4 ATM providers: AEON, E-net, Viewcard, or Daily Yamazaki.

QA.question: How do I activate my Wise card if I'm a cardholder in the US?
QA.answer: If you're in the US, follow these steps: 1) Go to your Wise account. 2) Go to Card. 3) Choose Activate your card. 4) Enter the 6-digit code on the sticker on the card. 5) Choose your PIN.

QA.question: What is the normal delivery time for Wise card in Australia?
QA.answer: 7-14 working days

QA.question: How can I check the status of my card delivery?
QA.answer: You can check the estimated delivery time under the Cards tab in your Wise account.

QA.question: What should I do if my Wise card has not arrived yet?
QA.answer: Double check the address, wait a couple of extra days, and if it still hasn't arrived, order a new card.

QA.question: How can I change my delivery address for the Wise card?
QA.answer: If you can't change your delivery address online, get in touch with us so we can help you order a new card.

QA.question: What are the steps to order a new Wise card if the first one didn't arrive?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise account, open the Cards tab, open the delivery information, select 'Card didn’t arrive? Order a new one', confirm to cancel the old card, and select Continue to place a new card order.

QA.question: How can I change my delivery address for my Wise card?
QA.answer: You can edit your delivery address before finishing your card order by following these steps: 1. Go to the Cards tab on the web or Card tab on the app; 2. Click on Your debit card order on the web or select Finish your card order on the app; 3. Select Edit address; 4. Edit the delivery address and click Continue; 5. Complete all required steps to finish your card order.

QA.question: Can I order a Wise card to an address different from my account address?
QA.answer: Yes, the delivery address for your Wise card doesn’t have to be the address on your account. You can order the card to your office, or to a friend or relative’s place.

QA.question: How do I change my account address if I've moved?
QA.answer: You can change your account address in the app or on the website, but you might have to submit a document. Here’s how we verify your address.

QA.question: What should I do if my Wise card never arrived, and the delivery estimate has passed?
QA.answer: You can order a new card to a different address without our help by following these steps: 1. Go to your Wise account in the app or on the website; 2. Open the Cards tab on the website, or the Card tab in the app; 3. Select Order a new one; 4. Select Cancel the old card; 5. Select Continue. (Note that if you order a new card this way, your original card will be cancelled automatically and you won’t be able to activate it)

QA.question: How can I order a new Wise card if my previous order hasn’t shipped yet, or it’s been shipped, but the delivery estimate hasn't passed?
QA.answer: We can cancel the card and help you order a new one. Contact our customer support for assistance.

QA.question: Can I get my new Wise card delivered abroad?
QA.answer: Yes, international delivery is available for Wise cards in most regions, with some exceptions for the USA and Brazil.

QA.question: Are Wise personal cards available for international delivery in Europe and the UK?
QA.answer: For the first order, personal cards can be delivered and activated in Europe only. Replacement cards can be delivered internationally.

QA.question: Can Wise business cards be delivered internationally?
QA.answer: Yes, business cards have international delivery as an option for the first and replacement orders.

QA.question: Is international delivery available for Wise cards in Australia, New Zealand, Japan, and Singapore?
QA.answer: Yes, personal and business cards have international delivery as an option for the first and replacement orders.

QA.question: Does Wise offer international delivery for personal cards in Malaysia and Canada?
QA.answer: Yes, personal cards have international delivery as an option for the first and replacement orders.

QA.question: Is international delivery available for Wise cards in the USA and Brazil?
QA.answer: No, international delivery is not available for the USA and Brazil at the moment.

QA.question: How can I change the name on my Wise card before completing the order?
QA.answer: When you order your card, Wise will show you a list of name suggestions based on your account name to choose from. Please ensure the name closely matches your Wise account and is within the 22-character limit.

QA.question: What happens if my name is longer than 22 characters?
QA.answer: If your name exceeds 22 characters (including spaces), parts of it will be abbreviated with initials, or removed.

QA.question: What if there are characters in my name that can't be printed on the card?
QA.answer: Any unprintable characters will be automatically converted to their Latin equivalent.

QA.question: Do the same name rules apply to personal and business cards?
QA.answer: Yes, the same name rules apply to both personal and business cards. However, business cards have a different design and the word 'business' printed on them.

QA.question: Can I change the name on my Wise card after completing the order?
QA.answer: No, once your card order is completed, you won’t be able to change the name on your card.

QA.question: Can I add my Wise card to Google Pay?
QA.answer: Yes, you can add your card to Google Pay if your address is in one of the supported countries, including Austria, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Bulgaria, Canada, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Guernsey, Hungary, Ireland, Isle of Man, Italy, Jersey, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Singapore, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the UK, and the US.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Google Pay via the Wise app?
QA.answer: 1. Open the Wise app. 2. Tap on the Card tab, where you can see all your available cards. 3. Select the card you'd like to add then tap on Add to G Pay.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Google Pay via the Google Wallet?
QA.answer: 1. Open the Google Wallet app. 2. At the bottom, tap Add to Wallet. 3. Select Payment card and then New credit or debit card. 4. Either scan your card or enter the details manually. 5. Follow the steps to verify your card.

QA.question: What are the limits for paying by Google Pay?
QA.answer: The normal limits for using the Wise card also apply when using Google Pay. Some merchants might also apply the contactless limit. Check the card limits on the Wise website or app.

QA.question: Can I add my Wise card to Apple Pay?
QA.answer: Yes, you can add your Wise card to Apple Pay if it was issued in Australia, Brazil, Canada, an EEA country where it’s supported, New Zealand, Singapore, the US or the UK. Wise cards issued in Japan and Malaysia are not currently supported.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Apple Pay via the Wise app?
QA.answer: 1. Open the Wise app. 2. Tap on the Card tab to see your available cards. 3. Select the card you'd like to add and tap on Add to Apple Wallet.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Apple Wallet on my iPhone?
QA.answer: 1. Open your Apple Wallet. 2. Scan your card or enter the details manually. 3. Verify the card with an SMS code.

QA.question: Will I be charged when adding my Wise card to Apple Pay?
QA.answer: You might see a small charge (possibly zero amount) on your account when adding your card to Apple Pay. This is to check that your card works, and it will be refunded back soon.

QA.question: What are the limits for paying with Apple Pay?
QA.answer: Transactions made with Apple Pay count towards the contactless limits if your card was issued in the US, and towards the Chip and PIN limit if it was issued in Australia, Singapore, New Zealand, or the EEA.

QA.question: Why can't I add my Wise card issued in Japan or Malaysia to Apple Pay?
QA.answer: Wise cards issued in Japan and Malaysia don’t currently work with Apple Pay. Wise is working to change that in the future.

QA.question: Can I add my Wise card to Garmin Pay or Fitbit Pay?
QA.answer: Yes, you can add your Wise card to Garmin Pay and Fitbit Pay if your address is in Australia, Brazil, EEA, the UK, New Zealand, Singapore, or Switzerland.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Garmin Pay?
QA.answer: 1. Open the Garmin Connect app, 2. Tap Garmin Pay, then the 3 dots, 3. Tap Add card, 4. Follow the on-screen instructions to finish setting up the card.

QA.question: How do I add my Wise card to Fitbit Pay?
QA.answer: 1. With your watch nearby, open the Fitbit app on your device, 2. Tap the Account icon, and your device image, 3. Tap the Wallet, 4. Follow the on-screen instructions to add a payment card. You also need to have Touch ID or a PIN turned on for your phone.

QA.question: Are there any charges for adding my Wise card to Fitbit Pay?
QA.answer: After you add your card, you might see a small charge (it may even be 0 USD) on your account. This is just to check that your card works, and it will be released back soon.

QA.question: What are the limits for paying by Garmin Pay or Fitbit Pay?
QA.answer: The normal limits for using the Wise card apply. Check the card limits on the Wise website. Some merchants might also apply the contactless limit, such as 30 GBP in the UK.

QA.question: Can I add my Wise card to my mobile wallet if I haven't received the SMS code?
QA.answer: If you don't get the SMS code, you can try sending the code again or try sending it by email to finish adding your card to your mobile wallet.

QA.question: Why can't I add my Wise card to my mobile wallet if I have an international phone number in my Wise account?
QA.answer: If you got your card in the US but have a non-US phone number, you can't add your card to your mobile wallet because the authentication text can't be sent to an international number. Wise is working to fix this issue.

QA.question: What should I do if I face trouble adding the Wise card to my mobile wallet?
QA.answer: If you face trouble adding your Wise card to your mobile wallet, first check if you've received the SMS code. If not, try resending the code or sending it via email. If the problem persists and you have an international phone number in your Wise account, you'll have to wait for Wise to fix the issue.

QA.question: How do I use my Wise card with Samsung Pay?
QA.answer: To add your Wise card to Samsung Pay, open the Samsung Pay app, click the + icon in the top right corner, click 'Add payment card', either scan your card or enter the details manually, and verify the card with an SMS code.

QA.question: Where can I use the Wise card with Samsung Pay?
QA.answer: You can use Samsung Pay with your Wise card in the US and in the UK if your card is a Mastercard.

QA.question: Are there any limits for paying with Samsung Pay using my Wise card?
QA.answer: The normal limits for using the Wise card apply when using Samsung Pay. Some merchants might also apply the contactless limit. In the UK, this is 30 GBP.

QA.question: Why am I seeing a small charge on my account after adding my card to Samsung Pay?
QA.answer: The small charge is just to check that your card works, and it will be released back soon.

QA.question: What should I do if I am having trouble adding my card to Samsung Pay?
QA.answer: If you'rehaving trouble adding your card to Samsung Pay, read the appropriate article on the Wise website for assistance.

QA.question: What should I do if my Wise card is lost or stolen?
QA.answer: You can either temporarily freeze your card or replace it to get a new one.

QA.question: How can I freeze my Wise card?
QA.answer: You can freeze your card through the Wise app or website by selecting the 'Card' tab and then selecting 'Freeze card'.

QA.question: Can I unfreeze my Wise card after freezing it?
QA.answer: Yes, you can unfreeze your card by following the same steps as freezing it in the Wise app or website.

QA.question: How can I replace my lost, stolen or damaged Wise card?
QA.answer: Using the Wise app or website, go to the 'Card' tab, choose 'Replace card', and select one of the options on the screen.

QA.question: How long does it take to get a replacement Wise card?
QA.answer: Delivery times depend on your region, ranging from 2 days to 30 days.

QA.question: What should I do if I notice an unauthorised transaction on my Wise card?
QA.answer: Report the unauthorized transaction using the 'Report an issue' link.

QA.question: How can I freeze my Wise card if I lost it?
QA.answer: Open the Wise app, tap on Card, and select Freeze card. Or log in to your Wise account on the website, select Cards, and then select Freeze card.

QA.question: How do I unfreeze my Wise card to use it again?
QA.answer: Follow the same steps as freezing: open the Wise app, tap on Card, and select Defrost card. Or on the website, log in to your Wise account, select Cards, and then select Defrost card.

QA.question: Can I make transactions with a frozen Wise card?
QA.answer: No, you cannot make any transactions with a frozen Wise card.

QA.question: What happens to my money when I freeze my Wise card?
QA.answer: Your money stays safe in your account while your card is frozen, and you cannot make any transactions.

QA.question: What could be the reason for a pending or delayed payment in my activity?
QA.answer: It could be due to pending payments from petrol stations, payments made offline, unfamiliar business names, unexpected small charges, or subscriptions.

QA.question: How long does it take for the actual amount spent at a petrol station to be charged?
QA.answer: The actual amount spent at a petrol station should be charged in 1-3 days, and the rest will be automatically refunded to your account.

QA.question: Why might I see delayed transactions in my activity?
QA.answer: Transactions made during a flight, at a subway station, or at a vending machine are often delayed and may appear in your activity later.

QA.question: What could cause an unfamiliar business name to appear in my transactions?
QA.answer: Transactions may be listed under a different trading name than the business you're familiar with. Google the name to see if you recognize it.

QA.question: What are unexpected small charges on my card?
QA.answer: Businesses might charge your card for a small amount to make sure it works. This is common for hotels and car rentals. These charges will usually be refunded within a few days.

QA.question: How can I resolve an issue with a transaction I didn't make?
QA.answer: First, check if the transaction is due to the reasons mentioned above. If not, contact the merchant and try to solve the problem together. If you still can't resolve it, report an issue to Wise.

QA.question: What information do I need to provide when reporting an issue?
QA.answer: You'll need to provide a description of what happened and what you purchased, any proof like receipts and invoices, and copies of all communication between you and the merchant.

QA.question: What should I do if I notice an unfamiliar payment in my Activity?
QA.answer: First, verify if it could be a pending payment, an offline transaction, an unfamiliar business name, an unexpected small charge, or a subscription. If you're sure the payment is fraudulent, freeze your card, report the issue, and wait for an investigation.

QA.question: How can I freeze my card if I suspect fraudulent activity?
QA.answer: Log in to Wise, click 'Cards' on the website or in Android, or 'Account' in iOS, then click 'Freeze my card'.

QA.question: How do I report a fraudulent payment?
QA.answer: Use the 'Report the issue' button in your Wise account and provide as much information as you can about the incident. Wise will get back to you within 1 working day.

QA.question: What transactions might appear as unfamiliar payments?
QA.answer: Unfamiliar payments could be pending payments from gas stations, delayed offline transactions, listed under different trading names, unexpected small charges, or subscription charges.

QA.question: After reporting a fraudulent payment, what should I expect?
QA.answer: Wise will investigate the issue and email you with the results, informing you if your card has been blocked. If it's blocked, you can order a new one.

QA.question: What is the time frame for Wise's response after reporting a fraudulent payment?
QA.answer: Wise will get back to you within 1 working day after you report a fraudulent payment.

QA.question: What should I do if I don't recognize a subscription on my account?
QA.answer: It's best to get in touch directly with the merchant who charged you to cancel the subscription or request a refund.

QA.question: How can I cancel an Amazon Prime subscription?
QA.answer: Contact Amazon customer support to manage this subscription or visit their website to find out more about cancelling it.

QA.question: What does an Apple.com/bill charge represent?
QA.answer: Apple.com/bill appears on your billing statement when you buy an app, music, movie, or other content from Apple, or when a subscription renews or a family member buys apps or content.

QA.question: How do I cancel an eDreams Prime subscription?
QA.answer: Contact eDreams support to end the subscription and request a refund.

QA.question: What is discreet billing?
QA.answer: Discreet billing is when a merchant, often adult content or online dating services, uses a different name on your account to maintain privacy. You can visit the merchant's website to cancel the subscription.

QA.question: What should I do if I'm charged for a subscription I've already cancelled?
QA.answer: Get in touch with the merchant and ask for a refund. If they're not able to help, file a dispute form, send Wise the cancellation confirmation, and they’ll take care of it for you.

QA.question: What can I do to avoid being charged for a free trial that turns into a paid subscription?
QA.answer: Set a reminder on your phone for a few days before the trial ends, so you can cancel in time before you’re charged for a full subscription.

QA.question: What should I do if I'm expecting money but it hasn't arrived yet?
QA.answer: Ask the person who sent the money to check its status by logging in to their Wise account. As a recipient, you cannot get specific details from the support team due to privacy and security reasons.

QA.question: What can I do if Wise has already sent the money but it's not in my account?
QA.answer: 1. Check the Currencies articles for your currency to find out estimated processing time. 2. Ask the sender for a transfer receipt and send it to your bank. 3. Check your bank details on the receipt and ensure they are correct.

QA.question: How long can it take for my bank to process the received money?
QA.answer: Processing times vary depending on the currency; for example, EUR can take 1-2 working days. Check the relevant Currencies article to find out.

QA.question: How can the sender find a transfer receipt?
QA.answer: The sender can find a transfer receipt by going to the relevant transfer in their Wise account's Activity section, clicking 'View transfer details,' and then 'Get PDF receipt.'

QA.question: What should I do if I found incorrect bank details on the transfer receipt?
QA.answer: Inform the sender about the mistake and ask them to follow the instructions to fix it.

QA.question: How do I receive money into my account?
QA.answer: To receive money into your account, share the account details of the currency you want to be paid in with the person or business who wants to pay you. You can get account details in various currencies, and the payment will go directly into that currency account in your account.

QA.question: What currencies can I receive money in?
QA.answer: You can receive money in USD, GBP, EUR, AUD, NZD, CAD, HUF, RON, TRY, and SGD, with more currencies on the way. RON account details are only available for residents of the EEA, Switzerland, the US, Canada, Australia, and Japan.

QA.question: How do I open a currency account?
QA.answer: To open a currency account, go to Home in the website or app, and follow the steps for opening a currency account in the desired currency.

QA.question: Are there any fees to receive payments using my account details?
QA.answer: There are no fees to receive payments using your account details, except for receiving US dollars domestic or SWIFT wires, which cost $4.14 per transaction.

QA.question: Is there a limit on how much I can receive in my currency accounts?
QA.answer: There is no limit for how much you can receive in your different currency accounts, with the exception of US dollars.

QA.question: Can I convert the money in my currency account to other currencies?
QA.answer: Yes, you can instantly convert the money to other currencies once it's in your currency accounts.

QA.question: Can I receive cash or cheque payments?
QA.answer: Wise doesn't accept cash or cheque payments. You can only receive payments in the same currency as your account.

QA.question: Can I get PLN account details?
QA.answer: You can't get PLN account details right now due to improvements needed in the PLN account details. However, if you already have PLN account details, you can keep using them as normal.

QA.question: What changed with the EUR account details in August 2020?
QA.answer: In August 2020, the old EUR account details were replaced with new ones that start with 'BE'. This change affects how the new EUR account details might impact you.

QA.question: Can I receive cash or cheque payments?
QA.answer: We can’t accept cash or cheque payments for any currency.

QA.question: What types of payments can I receive into my AUD account?
QA.answer: Using your AUD account number and BSB code, you can receive bank transfers in AUD from anywhere in Australia.

QA.question: Can I receive international SWIFT payments in CAD?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive international SWIFT payments in CAD.

QA.question: What types of payments can I receive into my EUR account?
QA.answer: Using your EUR IBAN, you can receive any SEPA transfers in EUR and international SWIFT payments in EUR.

QA.question: Can I receive payments in currencies other than GBP to my GBP account?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments in currencies other than GBP.

QA.question: What types of payments can I receive into my NZD account?
QA.answer: Using your NZD account number, you can receive bank transfers in NZD from anywhere in New Zealand.

QA.question: What types of payments can I receive into my SGD account?
QA.answer: Using your SGD account details, you can receive bank transfers in SGD from anywhere in Singapore (FAST).

QA.question: Can I receive international SWIFT payments in TRY?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive international SWIFT payments in TRY.

QA.question: What types of payments can I receive into my USD account?
QA.answer: Using your USD routing number and account number, you can receive ACH and domestic wire payments in USD from anywhere in the US, and using your USD SWIFT/BIC and account number, you can receive international wire/SWIFT payments in USD from certain countries.

QA.question: Are there any limits on how much money I can receive?
QA.answer: For most people, there are no limits on how much you can receive and hold. However, a few exceptions apply, such as certain routing numbers, account addresses in specific countries, and limits on specific currencies.

QA.question: What are the limits for USD account details with a routing number starting with 026?
QA.answer: For personal accounts, the limit is 20,000,000 USD per transaction and per day, and 35,000,000 USD per year. For business accounts, the limit is 30,000,000 USD per transaction and per day, and 50,000,000 USD per year. These limits apply for a rolling 365-day period.

QA.question: Are there any limits for USD accounts with a routing number starting with 084?
QA.answer: There are no limits to receive, add, convert, or hold money in your USD account with a routing number starting with 084.

QA.question: What are the limits for customers holding money with an account address in Singapore, Australia, Malaysia, or Japan?
QA.answer: Customers in Singapore and Australia have limits depending on their free allowance. Customers in Malaysia can't hold over 20,000 MYR on their balances. Customers in Japan can't hold more than 1 million JPY across all balances or jars.

QA.question: Do I need to provide any additional information or documents for receiving a certain amount?
QA.answer: Sometimes, depending on the amount you receive, we may need extra information and documents from you. If this is the case, we will contact you by email and inform you about the necessary steps.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive USD via wire transfer?
QA.answer: It takes 1 working day to receive a wire transfer.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive EUR from SEPA countries?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days.

QA.question: What is the time frame for receiving GBP sent from the UK?
QA.answer: It usually takes seconds, sometimes up to 1 working day.

QA.question: Can I receive AUD from countries other than Australia?
QA.answer: No, you can only receive AUD from Australia.

QA.question: What is the processing time for receiving NZD?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days to receive NZD.

QA.question: Are users still able to get PLN account details?
QA.answer: We've had to stop users getting PLN account details for the time being. If you already have PLN account details, you can keep using them as normal.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive CAD?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days to receive CAD.

QA.question: Can I receive TRY from countries other than Turkey?
QA.answer: No, you can only receive TRY from Turkey.

QA.question: What is the processing time for receiving RON?
QA.answer: It usually takes up to 1 working day to receive RON.

QA.question: What should I do if I haven't received my money within the specified timeframe?
QA.answer: First check with the sender if they used the correct account details. If you'd like us to investigate, please send us a proof of payment showing sender's name and account details, your name and account details, date they sent the money, and amount they sent.

QA.question: How much does it cost to receive USD wire transfers to my account?
QA.answer: Receiving USD wires to your account costs 4.14 USD per transaction.

QA.question: Will there be a fee for receiving ACH payments?
QA.answer: No, there's no fee to receive ACH payments or any kind of payment that uses your ACH routing number.

QA.question: Are there any fees for holding large amounts of AUD if I live in Australia?
QA.answer: Yes, fees are charged for holding large AUD amounts if you reside in Australia. Check the list of holding and receiving fees.

QA.question: Where can I find the latest fees for receiving money?
QA.answer: Check the latest fees for receiving money in the list of holding and receiving fees.

QA.question: What happens if I receive 1,000 USD through a wire transfer?
QA.answer: If you receive 1,000 USD through a wire transfer, 4.14 USD will be taken off, and 995.86 USD will be added to your USD account.

QA.question: Can the sender's bank charge fees before the money reaches my account?
QA.answer: Yes, the sender's bank may charge fees before the money reaches your account. It's recommended for the sender to check with their bank.

QA.question: Can I receive large amounts of money into my Wise account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can receive large amounts into any balance with account details. But there are a couple of things you should know beforehand.

QA.question: Will I be asked for more information when receiving a large amount?
QA.answer: Yes, we may need to ask you about your relationship with the sender, or the purpose of the payment. This is a regulatory requirement and helps ensure our services are safe for everyone.

QA.question: Are there any limits for receiving money?
QA.answer: There are no limits for most currencies, but there are limits for USD balances when the routing number starts with 026.

QA.question: What are the limits for USD balances when the routing number starts with 026?
QA.answer: For personal accounts, there's a limit of 20,000,000 USD per transaction and per day, and 35,000,000 USD per year. For business accounts, it's 30,000,000 USD per transaction and per day, and 50,000,000 USD per year.

QA.question: Do these limits apply when the routing number starts with 084?
QA.answer: No, these limits do not apply when your account details have a routing number starting with 084.

QA.question: Do the limits apply when adding money using the 'Add money' button?
QA.answer: No, the limits don't apply when you top up your USD balance using the 'Add money' button in your account.

QA.question: Do the limits apply when converting money from other currencies?
QA.answer: No, the limits don't apply when you convert money from other currencies in your account.

QA.question: Do I need to send any documents before receiving a large amount?
QA.answer: No, you don't need to send any documents before receiving the money. Transfers are reviewed on a case by case basis.

QA.question: What information might be needed when I receive a large amount?
QA.answer: You might need to provide details about your relationship with the sender, the source of the sender's funds, and the purpose of the transfer.

QA.question: Why do you sometimes require additional information for large transfers?
QA.answer: This is a regulatory requirement, which helps us ensure the safety and security of our services for all users.

QA.question: How do I request money using Wise?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise personal or business account, select the currency you'd like to request the payment in, click on 'Request', fill out the amount, and click on 'Create payment link'. Share the payment link with your company, clients, family, or friends.

QA.question: Do I need account details to request money?
QA.answer: Yes, you have to have account details for the feature to work.

QA.question: How do I check the status of my payment requests?
QA.answer: If you're logged in via the web, click 'Manage' and then 'Payment requests'. If you're logged in via the app, click 'Manage' and then 'Requested payments'.

QA.question: Can I request payments in any currency?
QA.answer: You can only request payments in currencies that you've opened balances for and have account details activated.

QA.question: How do I open a balance or activate account details?
QA.answer: Refer to the guides on 'How to open a balance' and 'How to activate account details' provided by Wise.

QA.question: Are there any fees to receive payments using my Wise account details?
QA.answer: There are no fees, except for receiving US dollars domestic or SWIFT wires that cost $4.14 per transaction.

QA.question: Is there a limit for how much I can receive to my different accounts?
QA.answer: There's no limit for receiving money in most currencies, except for US dollars, which may have some restrictions.

QA.question: How do I get account details to receive money?
QA.answer: To get account details, open a balance in one of the supported currencies and complete the required steps on the Wise platform, such as verifying your identity and adding funds to your account.

QA.question: What are the requirements for getting my personal Wise account details?
QA.answer: To get your first set of account details, you'll need to add 20 GBP to your account (or the equivalent in your currency) and verify your identity. For USD or EUR account details, you'll also need to upload a photo of yourself holding your ID.

QA.question: What are the requirements for getting my Wise Business account details?
QA.answer: For EEA, Switzerland, and the UK, there's a one-time onboarding fee of 45 GBP (50 EUR). For other regions, the fee to open account details depends on your business's location. After paying the fee, Wise will verify your business and provide your account details.

QA.question: Do I need to complete the requirements for each currency balance in my Wise account?
QA.answer: No, you only need to complete the requirements for the first set of account details. After that, you can freely get account details for any of the other currencies that have them.

QA.question: How do I verify my identity for Wise?
QA.answer: To verify your identity, follow the steps provided by Wise, such as uploading a photo of your ID, and completing any additional requirements they may have.

QA.question: How do I find my account details after opening a currency balance in Wise?
QA.answer: Once you have the balance opened, click on **Receive** on the website, or **More** on the app, and then select **Get account details**. Your account details will also show in your **Manage** tab in the **Account details** section.

QA.question: What are AUD account details?
QA.answer: AUD account details are your own account details to receive Australian dollars (AUD) with zero fees. It includes an account number and BSB code to receive money from any Australian bank account.

QA.question: How do I use my AUD account details to receive money?
QA.answer: Share your AUD account name, number, and BSB code with the person who wants to pay you. They can pay you via local bank transfer, but not through international wire or SWIFT.

QA.question: Are there any fees involved in receiving AUD?
QA.answer: No, there are no fees for receiving Australian dollars with your AUD account details.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive AUD into my account?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days to receive AUD into your account.

QA.question: Can I receive RTGS payments or transfers from Australian Superannuation Funds?
QA.answer: No, you won't be able to receive RTGS payments, or transfers from Australian Superannuation Funds and Self Managed Superannuation Funds.

QA.question: Can I set up Direct Debits with my AUD account details?
QA.answer: Yes, you can share your AUD account details with a company and give them permission to take regular payments from your account, such as for monthly subscriptions or bills.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside Australia?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments from outside Australia or in currencies other than AUD.

QA.question: What are CAD account details?
QA.answer: CAD account details are your personal account, institution, and transit numbers used to receive Canadian dollars (CAD) from any Canadian bank account.

QA.question: How do I get CAD account details?
QA.answer: You can get CAD account details by signing up with the fintech service that provides an account for CAD.

QA.question: Which payment methods can I use to receive CAD?
QA.answer: You can receive CAD using EFT credits (also known as direct deposits) or Interac Autodeposit.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside of Canada or in currencies other than CAD to my CAD account?
QA.answer: No, you can’t receive payments from outside of Canada or in currencies other than CAD to your CAD account details.

QA.question: How long does it usually take to receive CAD into my account?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1 to 2 days to receive CAD into your account, but it can sometimes take up to 3 days.

QA.question: Can I set up Direct Debits with my CAD account details?
QA.answer: Yes, you can share your CAD account details with a company and give them permission to take regular payments from your account for subscriptions or bills.

QA.question: What happens if someone sends a domestic wire or SWIFT transfer to my CAD account?
QA.answer: If someone sends a domestic wire or SWIFT transfer to your CAD account, the payment will be automatically returned with money deducted to cover return processing fees; 50 CAD for SWIFT transfers and 25 CAD for domestic wires.

QA.question: What are EUR account details?
QA.answer: EUR account details are your own account details, including account name, IBAN and SWIFT/BIC code, to receive euros (EUR) with zero fees.

QA.question: Is a Wise EUR account a bank account?
QA.answer: No, it isn't a bank account, but the IBAN and SWIFT/BIC code provided work in the same way when receiving money.

QA.question: How can I receive EUR with my account details?
QA.answer: Share your account name, IBAN and SWIFT/BIC code with friends, company, or customers, so they can send you EUR from their bank account.

QA.question: How long do SEPA and SWIFT transfers take?
QA.answer: SEPA transfers usually take 0-2 working days, while SWIFT transfers take 2-5 working days.

QA.question: Can I set up Direct Debits with my EUR account details?
QA.answer: Yes, you can share your details with a company and give them permission to take regular payments from your account.

QA.question: What should I do if a merchant is blocking my Direct Debit?
QA.answer: Let Wise know using the provided form, and report the merchant to the relevant authority in your country.

QA.question: What are the correspondent bank details for receiving EUR via SWIFT?
QA.answer: Recipient SWIFT code/BIC: TRWIBEB1XXX, Correspondent SWIFT code/BIC: BARCGB22.

QA.question: What if a bank isn't recognising my Wise account details?
QA.answer: Fill out the provided form to inform Wise, and get in touch with the Wise team to receive a document to help the bank understand what they need to do.

QA.question: What are GBP account details?
QA.answer: GBP account details are your personal account details used to receive British pounds (GBP) with zero fees. They include your account name, number, and sort code.

QA.question: How do I use my GBP account details to receive money?
QA.answer: Share your account name, number, and sort code with the person who wants to send you money. They can send GBP from any UK bank account without any fees.

QA.question: Do I need a bank account to use GBP account details?
QA.answer: No, this isn't a bank account, but the account number and sort code work in the same way when receiving money.

QA.question: What are the payment methods to receive GBP?
QA.answer: You can receive GBP through the Faster Payments System (FPS), Bacs, CHAPS, or SWIFT.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive GBP through FPS, Bacs, or CHAPS?
QA.answer: It can take up to 1 working day to receive GBP through the FPS, Bacs, or CHAPS.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive GBP through SWIFT?
QA.answer: It can take 4-5 working days to receive GBP through SWIFT.

QA.question: Can I use my GBP account details to set up Direct Debits?
QA.answer: Yes, you can share your GBP account details with a company and give them permission to take regular payments for services like monthly subscriptions or bills.

QA.question: What are HUF account details?
QA.answer: HUF account details are your personal account details to receive Hungarian forints (HUF) with zero fees, working in the same way as any Hungarian bank account when receiving money.

QA.question: How do I get HUF account details?
QA.answer: To get HUF account details, sign in to your account, and the details will be provided to you.

QA.question: How do I use my HUF account details to receive money?
QA.answer: Share your HUF account number with your friends, company, or customers, and they can send you HUF from any Hungarian bank account.

QA.question: Can I receive money using international wire (SWIFT) with HUF account details?
QA.answer: No, you cannot receive money using international wire (SWIFT) with HUF account details. They can only pay you by local bank transfer.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive payments up to 10,000,000 HUF?
QA.answer: Payments up to 10,000,000 HUF typically arrive in a few seconds.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive payments above 10,000,000 HUF?
QA.answer: Payments above 10,000,000 HUF may take a bit longer, usually within a few hours on working days or on the next working day during weekends.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside Hungary or in currencies other than HUF?
QA.answer: No, you cannot receive payments from outside Hungary or in currencies other than HUF.

QA.question: What are MYR account details?
QA.answer: MYR account details are your own account details to receive Malaysian Ringgit (MYR) with zero fees. It's not a bank account, but the account number works in the same way when receiving money from any Malaysian bank account.

QA.question: How do I get MYR account details?
QA.answer: MYR account details are only available for personal customers who are resident in Malaysia.

QA.question: How can someone send me MYR using my MYR account details?
QA.answer: Share your MYR account details with the sender. They can pay you by local bank transfer in Malaysia using RPP or GIRO.

QA.question: What is the difference between RPP and GIRO?
QA.answer: RPP transfers will arrive in your account in seconds, while GIRO transfers take up to 1 working day.

QA.question: How much MYR can I hold in my personal account?
QA.answer: If you live in Malaysia, you can only hold up to 20,000 MYR in your personal account.

QA.question: How can I withdraw MYR to an external bank account?
QA.answer: To add your bank account for withdrawal, please refer to the provided guide for more information.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside Malaysia or in currencies other than MYR with my MYR account details?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments from outside Malaysia or in currencies other than MYR with your MYR account details.

QA.question: What are NZD account details?
QA.answer: NZD account details are your personal account details to receive New Zealand dollars (NZD) with zero fees from any New Zealand bank account.

QA.question: How do I use my NZD account details to receive money?
QA.answer: Share your NZD account number and the local address listed with your details to the person sending you money. They can send you NZD by local bank transfer from any New Zealand bank account.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside New Zealand?
QA.answer: No, you cannot receive payments from outside New Zealand or in currencies other than NZD.

QA.question: What if the sender's bank asks for a 3-digit suffix?
QA.answer: Add a 0 before the last 2 digits of your account number. For example, if your account number is 11-2222-3333333-44, use 11-2222-3333333-044 instead.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive NZD into my account?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days to receive NZD into your account.

QA.question: What are PLN account details?
QA.answer: PLN account details are your personal account details to receive Polish złoty (PLN) with zero fees from any Polish bank account.

QA.question: Is this PLN account a bank account?
QA.answer: No, this isn't a bank account, but the account number provided works in the same way when receiving money.

QA.question: Does Wise legally own the account number for my PLN account?
QA.answer: Yes, your account number is legally owned by Wise and personally assigned to you.

QA.question: Can I still get PLN account details if I don't have them?
QA.answer: No, currently Wise has stopped issuing PLN account details, but they will announce when they are available again.

QA.question: How can someone send money to my PLN account?
QA.answer: The sender can pay you via local bank transfer using your PLN account details.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside Poland or in currencies other than PLN?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments from outside Poland, or in currencies other than PLN.

QA.question: Are international wire or SWIFT payments accepted?
QA.answer: No, payments using international wire or SWIFT, and cash deposits at Poczta Polska are not accepted.

QA.question: Does Wise support split VAT payments?
QA.answer: No, Wise doesn't accept split VAT payments.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive PLN into my account?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1-2 working days to receive PLN into your account.

QA.question: Are instant transfers supported for my PLN account details?
QA.answer: No, instant transfers to your PLN account details are not supported.

QA.question: What are RON account details?
QA.answer: RON account details are unique account details assigned to you for receiving Romanian leu (RON) without fees. While it's not a bank account, it works the same way when receiving money from any Romanian bank account.

QA.question: Who is eligible to get RON account details?
QA.answer: You can get RON account details if you're a resident in the EEA, UK, Switzerland, the US, Canada, Australia, or Japan.

QA.question: How do I receive Romanian leu (RON) using my RON account details?
QA.answer: First, obtain RON account details. Then, share them with the person sending you money. They should pay you through a local bank transfer, not international wire or SWIFT. It takes 1–2 working days for RON to reach your account.

QA.question: Can I receive international payments or other currencies with my RON account details?
QA.answer: No, you can only receive payments from within Romania and in RON currency using your RON account details.

QA.question: Are there any fees for receiving RON?
QA.answer: No, there are no fees for receiving Romanian leu (RON) using your RON account details.

QA.question: What are SGD account details?
QA.answer: SGD account details are your unique account details to receive Singapore dollars (SGD) with zero fees. This works similarly to a bank account when receiving money.

QA.question: How can I receive SGD to my personal Wise account?
QA.answer: You can receive money through FAST (Fast And Secure Transfers) as well as PayNow. You cannot receive using GIRO, MEPS, international wire, SWIFT, or by cash deposits.

QA.question: Is there a limit to how much SGD I can receive in my personal Wise account?
QA.answer: Your SGD account details can only receive up to 200,000 SGD per transfer, but there's no limit on how many transfers you can receive per day.

QA.question: Why is there a 5,000 SGD limit on my personal Wise account balance if my address is in Singapore?
QA.answer: This is because Wise is regulated by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) under the Payment Services Act.

QA.question: What are the two sets of account details for my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: 1. Receive money instantly through FAST, with a transfer limit of 200,000 SGD per transfer. 2. Receive money from platforms like Google or Stripe through GIRO and MEPS, with no limit on how much money you can receive per transfer.

QA.question: How long does it take for payments to arrive in my Wise Business account via GIRO and MEPS?
QA.answer: Payments can take 1-3 working days to arrive in your account.

QA.question: Why might senders see DBS as the bank when they enter my Wise Business account details?
QA.answer: DBS is Wise's partner bank, and Wise holds accounts with them. If the sender needs a branch code, they should use 003.

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside Singapore or in currencies other than SGD?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments from outside Singapore or in currencies other than SGD.

QA.question: What should I do if there are mistakes in the account details I shared with my sender?
QA.answer: Make sure to share your unique account details with your sender without mistakes, as these details are unique to you and errors may cause issues with receiving payments.

QA.question: Can I get TRY account details if I have a Türkiye address?
QA.answer: Due to regulation changes, as of 31st March 2023, customers with a Türkiye address are no longer able to get TRY account details.

QA.question: Can I get TRY account details if I am outside of Türkiye?
QA.answer: Currently, TRY account details are temporarily not being offered to customers outside of Türkiye.

QA.question: What are TRY account details?
QA.answer: TRY account details are your very own account details to receive Turkish Lira (TRY) with zero fees, using an IBAN that works like any Turkish bank account when receiving money.

QA.question: What is the maximum amount of money I can receive in an individual payment?
QA.answer: You can receive individual payments of up to 1 million TRY to your account details.

QA.question: Is there a limit on how much I can hold in my TRY account balance?
QA.answer: There is no limit to how much you can hold in your balance.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive TRY into my account?
QA.answer: It usually takes 1 working day to receive TRY into your account.

QA.question: Can I receive international wire (SWIFT) payments in TRY?
QA.answer: No, you can only receive payments via local bank transfer, not using international wire (SWIFT).

QA.question: Can I receive payments from outside of Turkey or in currencies other than TRY?
QA.answer: No, you can't receive payments from outside Turkey or in currencies other than TRY.

QA.question: What are USD account details and how do I get them?
QA.answer: USD account details are the information needed to receive US dollars into your Wise account. They include your name, account number, routing number(s), SWIFT code, and local US address.

QA.question: Can I use my USD account details to receive other currencies?
QA.answer: No, your USD account details can only receive USD. To receive other currencies, you can get account details in another currency or ask your sender to sign up with Wise.

QA.question: What is the purpose of the routing number?
QA.answer: The routing number is used to identify the bank when transferring funds between accounts. It serves as an address for the bank to which the money is being sent.

QA.question: What happens if my sender uses the wrong routing number?
QA.answer: If the wrong routing number is used, the money will bounce back to the sender's account within 3 working days. If it doesn't, they should contact their bank to set up a trace on the money.

QA.question: How long does it take for a SWIFT transfer to reach Wise?
QA.answer: A SWIFT transfer can take 4-5 working days to reach Wise.

QA.question: What information should I provide my sender for a SWIFT transfer?
QA.answer: Provide your sender with your account number, SWIFT/BIC code, and the local address on your details: TransferWise, 30 W. 26th Street, Sixth Floor, New York, NY, 10010, United States.

QA.question: What if my sender doesn't include the address in the SWIFT transfer?
QA.answer: If the address is not provided, the payment will be rejected and it can take 3-10 working days, sometimes longer, for the money to be returned to the sender.

QA.question: Can I set up Direct Debits with my USD account details?
QA.answer: Yes, you can share your details with a company and give them permission to take regular payments from your account, such as monthly subscriptions or bills.

QA.question: How can I receive money from multiple Amazon marketplaces with Wise?
QA.answer: To receive money from multiple Amazon marketplaces using Wise, set up your Wise account details to receive local currency payments by visiting the Bank Account Info section in your Amazon seller account. Follow the instructions to add the required bank details depending on your marketplace.

QA.question: Which Amazon marketplaces are Wise account details compatible with?
QA.answer: Wise account details are compatible with Amazon US, Amazon Europe, Amazon UK, and Amazon Australia.

QA.question: How do I set up my Wise account details on Amazon?
QA.answer: To set up your Wise account details on Amazon, go to Settings > Account Info > Payment Info > Bank Account Info. Add or replace bank details and add the required account information for your marketplace. Save the details by clicking Set deposit method.

QA.question: What information do I need to add for Amazon Europe?
QA.answer: For Amazon Europe, add your IBAN and BIC details.

QA.question: What information do I need to add for Amazon US?
QA.answer: For Amazon US, add your account number and routing number (ACH if you have 2) to receive electronic payments only.

QA.question: What information do I need to add for Amazon UK?
QA.answer: For Amazon UK, add your sort code and bank account number.

QA.question: What information do I need to add for Amazon Australia?
QA.answer: For Amazon Australia, add your AUD BSB code, account number, and the account holder name.

QA.question: What should non-US residents using Amazon US Marketplace do for tax verification?
QA.answer: Non-US residents using the Amazon US Marketplace should sign the document provided by Amazon stating that they are non-US citizens and not taxpayers in the US. Payments and new product postings will remain pending until the signed document is sent back to Amazon.

QA.question: Which currencies can I link my Wise account to Stripe?
QA.answer: You can link EUR, GBP, USD, AUD, NZD, SGD, RON, PLN and CAD account details to Stripe. The supported currency can depend on your location.

QA.question: How do I link my Wise account to Stripe?
QA.answer:
1. Log in to your Stripe Dashboard.
2. Open Settings in the left-hand menu.
3. Click Bank accounts and scheduling.
4. Click Add a bank account.
5. Enter your Wise account details corresponding to the desired balance.

QA.question: What should I do if my Wise account is blocked on Stripe?
QA.answer: Double-check the entered account details for any typos or errors. If the problem persists, contact Stripe with the correct details. If the issue is due to a negative balance resulting from refunds or disputes, contact Stripe to arrange an alternative way to clear the negative balance.

QA.question: Can I receive money from Upwork to my Wise account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can receive money from Upwork in your Wise account, preferably in USD.

QA.question: What currency should I choose to receive money from Upwork?
QA.answer: It's best to get paid in USD and convert the money with Wise.

QA.question: How do I set up my USD account details on Upwork?
QA.answer: Go to Settings, select Get paid, click on Payment details and Add method, choose Direct to US Bank (USD), provide your Wise USD account details, and confirm the information.

QA.question: What happens if Upwork can't find the branch of the bank?
QA.answer: In case Upwork can't find the bank branch, you can add the bank address manually by selecting 'Enter branch address manually'.

QA.question: How will Upwork verify my Wise USD account?
QA.answer: Upwork might send 1 or 2 microdeposits to your Wise USD account that will take 1-3 days to arrive. You'll need to go to Upwork and confirm the amounts received.

QA.question: How do I receive money from Etsy with Wise?
QA.answer: When creating your Etsy account, select USD as your Shop currency. After setting up your account, go to Shop Manager > Finances > Payment settings > Update, and add your Wise USD account details.

QA.question: Why should I choose USD as my Shop currency on Etsy?
QA.answer: Since Etsy operates in USD, choosing USD as your Shop currency will help you save money on conversion fees when withdrawing money to your Wise USD account.

QA.question: Can I change my Shop currency on Etsy after setting up my account?
QA.answer: No, you cannot change your Shop currency after setting up your Etsy account. Choose the currency you think you'll have the most sales in to save on conversion fees.

QA.question: How does Etsy handle currency conversion fees?
QA.answer: If you sell using a different currency than your Shop currency, Etsy will convert the money from the sale currency to your Shop currency using a conversion fee.

QA.question: How do I set up my USD account details on Etsy?
QA.answer: Go to Shop Manager > Finances > Payment settings > Update, and add your Wise USD account details.

QA.question: How does Etsy verify my Wise USD account?
QA.answer: Etsy might send you 1 or 2 microdeposits to your Wise USD account to verify your ownership. It can take 3–7 days for the deposits to arrive, and you'll need to confirm the amounts received by going to Finances > Payment account > Verify account on Etsy.

QA.question: Can I use my Wise account to receive payments from GOAT?
QA.answer: Yes, GOAT app users can use their Wise account to receive payments in USD.

QA.question: What currency does GOAT operate in?
QA.answer: GOAT operates in USD, but you can transact in any of the 11 currencies listed on their app.

QA.question: How does GOAT convert currencies?
QA.answer: GOAT will first convert from USD to your preferred currency at their defined exchange rate and conversion fee.

QA.question: What's the advantage of using a Wise account to receive USD from GOAT?
QA.answer: Using a Wise account can help you save on conversion fees when receiving payments in USD from GOAT.

QA.question: How do I set up my USD account details on GOAT?
QA.answer: To set up your USD account details on GOAT, make sure you have your USD account details and your seller request is approved. Then, select 'Credits', 'Cash out', 'Cash out method', and add your USD account details from Wise.

QA.question: How long does it take for a payment from GOAT to be deposited into my USD account?
QA.answer: Once your cash out method has been approved, your payment can take 2-3 working days to be deposited into your USD account.

QA.question: Are there any restrictions on business transfers?
QA.answer: Yes, in some cases, business transfers are slightly more limited due to the way Wise is regulated in those countries.

QA.question: Can my business send AUD?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise supports both sending and receiving AUD from businesses.

QA.question: Can I send BRL to a business account?
QA.answer: No, Wise cannot pay out BRL to any businesses.

QA.question: Are there any business limitations for EUR transfers?
QA.answer: No, there are no business limitations for EUR.

QA.question: Can I send money to a business in China using CNY?
QA.answer: Yes, but businesses in China can't receive CNY from AED and TRY.

QA.question: Can businesses send IDR?
QA.answer: No, businesses can't send IDR. Only individuals can send IDR to businesses.

QA.question: What's the daily limit for sending INR to business recipients in India?
QA.answer: You can send a maximum of 1,500,000 INR in total per day to business recipients in India.

QA.question: Can I make transfers to businesses in Nepal?
QA.answer: No, Wise cannot make transfers to any businesses in Nepal.

QA.question: Are there any business limitations for USD transfers?
QA.answer: See the business types Wise can support for the US.

QA.question: Can I send money to a business in Vietnam using VND?
QA.answer: No, Wise cannot make transfers to any businesses in Vietnam.

QA.question: Can my business get a Wise card?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise Business cards are available for businesses in various countries across Europe, North America, Asia, and Oceania. However, availability may differ based on your business structure and location.

QA.question: Where can I use my Wise Business card?
QA.answer: You can use your Wise Business card to pay for business expenses and spend online or in-store anywhere in the world.

QA.question: What happens if I don't have the required currency in my account?
QA.answer: If you don't have the currency in your account, Wise will automatically convert the amount for you.

QA.question: How long does it take to receive my Wise Business card?
QA.answer: The delivery time depends on your location. It can take 3 working days in Singapore, 2-6 days in the UK, within 2 weeks in Europe, and up to 3 weeks in Australia and New Zealand.

QA.question: Can US businesses request a physical Wise Business card?
QA.answer: US businesses can only request new Wise Digital cards. However, if you already have a physical US business card, you can continue to use it and replace it if needed.

QA.question: Are Wise Business cards available to businesses with multiple shareholders?
QA.answer: For US businesses, cards are currently only available for sole traders/sole proprietorships with no shareholders/Ultimate Business Owners (UBOs) or businesses with only 1 shareholder, where the owner of the profile is the UBO. Cards for businesses with multiple shareholders are being worked on for the future.

QA.question: What if my country or region is not on the list for Wise Business cards?
QA.answer: If your country or region is not on the list, you can join the waitlist and Wise will notify you when cards become available in your area.

QA.question: Can my business use Wise?
QA.answer: Wise Business works for various types of businesses, including freelancers, entrepreneurs, and large-scale enterprises. Wise supports businesses in the EEA, Canada, US, UK, Switzerland, Australia, and New Zealand.

QA.question: Does Wise support sole traders and freelancers?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise works for sole traders and freelancers.

QA.question: Can a charity or trust use Wise?
QA.answer: Wise works for charities and trusts in the EEA, Canada, US, UK, Switzerland, Australia, and New Zealand. It doesn't work for charities and trusts in countries not listed or unregistered UK charities.

QA.question: Is Wise suitable for businesses involved in cryptocurrency, tobacco, or adult content?
QA.answer: No, Wise doesn't work for businesses involved in cryptocurrency, tobacco, adult content, or other prohibited activities.

QA.question: Can a Brazilian business make transfers in BRL using Wise?
QA.answer: No, Brazilian businesses cannot make transfers in BRL using Wise.

QA.question: Does Wise support Superannuation Funds or Self Managed Superannuation Funds (SMSF) in Australia?
QA.answer: No, Wise does not support Superannuation Funds or SMSF in Australia.

QA.question: Can businesses offering goods or services related to Cuba with US relations use Wise?
QA.answer: No, Wise does not support businesses that offer services or goods relating to Cuba with US relations.

QA.question: Are businesses with bearer shares supported by Wise?
QA.answer: No, Wise does not support businesses with bearer shares, regardless of the jurisdiction they are incorporated in.

QA.question: Can I have multiple Wise business accounts for different businesses?
QA.answer: Yes, you can have Wise accounts for each of your businesses under one set of login details.

QA.question: How can I set up an additional Wise business account?
QA.answer: 1. Go to your Wise account and select your name in the top right corner. 2. Select 'Switch account'. 3. Choose 'Get a business account' and follow on-screen instructions.

QA.question: Can I have more than one account for the same business?
QA.answer: No, you can only have one account per business or entity.

QA.question: How can I switch between my different Wise business accounts?
QA.answer: Go to your Wise account, select your name in the top right corner, and then select 'Switch account'.

QA.question: Can I send money from a business bank account using Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, you can send money from a business bank account as long as you have a Wise Business account. Payments from business bank accounts cannot be accepted through a personal Wise account.

QA.question: What should I do if I accidentally sent money from a business bank account using my personal Wise account?
QA.answer: If you have a Wise Business account but used your personal Wise account for the transfer, you don't need to do anything. Wise can typically fix this on their end and process the transfer. If they need more information, they'll contact you via email.

QA.question: What if I don't have a Wise Business account but used my personal Wise account to transfer from a business bank account?
QA.answer: If you don't have a Wise Business account, Wise can't process your payment. You should cancel the transfer, open a Wise Business account, and restart the transfer. Verifying a new account can take 4-7 business days.

QA.question: How can I cancel a transfer from my personal Wise account?
QA.answer: You can cancel a transfer depending on its stage in the system. Track the transfer in your account to check its status, and follow the instructions provided to cancel the transfer if possible.

QA.question: What happens if my money is being processed in an incorrect transfer?
QA.answer: If the money has reached Wise and is being processed, you can't cancel the transfer yourself. Wise will stop the transfer and contact you via email, where you can choose to set up a Wise Business account to continue or cancel the transfer and receive a refund.

QA.question: How do I move money between my Wise business and personal accounts?
QA.answer: 1. Find the bank details for the receiving account. 2. Switch to the account you want to send money from. 3. Click on the currency you want to send. 4. Click Send, and enter the amount. 5. Create a recipient using the bank details for the account you're sending to.

QA.question: How do I find my bank details for receiving money?
QA.answer: 1. Switch to the account you want to receive money into. 2. Click on the currency you want to receive to see your bank details. 3. Keep these bank details on hand for setting up your transfer.

QA.question: How do I set up a transfer between my Wise accounts?
QA.answer: 1. Switch to the account you want to send money from. 2. Click on the currency you want to send. 3. Click Send, and enter the amount. 4. Create a recipient using the bank details for the account you're sending to.

QA.question: How do I add a reference to a transfer?
QA.answer: When creating a transfer, you can add a reference in Step 4 of the setup. Check the table provided for the limitations on references in different receiving currencies.

QA.question: What is the maximum reference length allowed for a USD transfer?
QA.answer: For a USD transfer, the maximum reference length allowed is 10 characters.

QA.question: How do I make sure my recipient gets the exact amount?
QA.answer: There are 2 ways to send an exact amount with Wise: 1. Use the guaranteed rate feature. 2. Amount lock transfer - enter the amount you want your recipient to receive and click the lock icon in the 'Recipient gets' box.

QA.question: What is the 'guaranteed rate feature'?
QA.answer: The guaranteed rate feature ensures that as long as Wise receives your money within a specified amount of time, the rate you saw when creating the transfer will be the rate you get.

QA.question: How does the 'amount lock transfer' work?
QA.answer: Enter the amount you want your recipient to receive, click the lock icon in the 'Recipient gets' box. Wise will take an extra 3% on top of your deposit to cover any rate changes during conversion. Once the payout is completed, Wise refunds any unused portion of the 3%.

QA.question: How do I set up a Wise Business account?
QA.answer: To set up a Wise Business account, provide details about your business and the person who will manage the account. Verification may be required depending on the amount of money you wish to send and the destination.

QA.question: What should the source of the money be when sending money on behalf of my business?
QA.answer: When sending money on behalf of your business, the money must come from your business bank account with the same name as the business registered with Wise.

QA.question: What do I do if I set up a personal transfer instead of a business transfer?
QA.answer: If you set up a personal transfer from a business bank account (or vice versa), please contact Wise customer support to resolve the issue.

QA.question: Can I manage payments for multiple businesses?
QA.answer: Yes, if you own or wish to make payments on behalf of 2 or more businesses, contact Wise for assistance in setting this up.

QA.question: What do I need to do if my business changes its entity type or becomes incorporated?
QA.answer: If your business changes its entity type or becomes incorporated, you’ll need to be re-verified and provide proof of the change to Wise.

QA.question: How do I open a Wise account for my business?
QA.answer: It only takes a few minutes to set up your Wise Business account. Enter some details about yourself and your business. Verification might be required before completing any transfers.

QA.question: Is Wise Business a safe platform?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise is regulated like a bank and registered with numerous financial authorities. They use HTTPS encryption and two-factor authentication to keep your transactions secure.

QA.question: How is Wise Business cheaper than PayPal?
QA.answer: Wise never marks up the exchange rate and always gives the real mid-market rate. Banks and services like PayPal often set their own unfriendly rates, which makes them more expensive.

QA.question: Can I automate my finances with Wise Business?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise Business offers an open API to connect your account with your business tools, automating payments and workflows. It also works with accounting tools like Xero.

QA.question: Can I add other users to my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise Business supports multi-user access with different permissions and access levels. They'll also be introducing approvals soon.

QA.question: How can I open a personal account for my business on the Wise website?
QA.answer: Click on your business name in the top right corner and choose 'Get a personal account' from the dropdown menu.

QA.question: How can I open a personal account for my business using the mobile app?
QA.answer: Click on the circle in the top left corner to go to 'Your account'. Then, click 'Open a personal account' under Other accounts and follow the steps.

QA.question: Is it possible to open a personal account for my business on both the iOS and Android mobile apps?
QA.answer: Yes, you can open a personal account using both the iOS and Android mobile apps.

QA.question: What should I do if I've ended my business and need to close my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: Share our email thirdpartyrequests@wise.com with your liquidator or the insolvency administrator. They will reach out to our team, and we'll follow their instructions to deactivate your account and transfer the remaining funds.
