QA.question: Who should my liquidator or insolvency administrator contact to close my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: They should contact our team at thirdpartyrequests@wise.com.

QA.question: What happens to my remaining funds in the Wise Business account when my business enters insolvency or liquidation proceedings?
QA.answer: Your Wise Business account will be deactivated, and the remaining funds will be transferred to the details specified by your liquidator or insolvency administrator.

QA.question: Why do I need to verify my business account with Wise?
QA.answer: Verification helps to keep your money safe and comply with the financial regulations in the countries Wise operates in. It is essential to confirm your identity, the active status of your business, and ensure it meets the acceptable use policy.

QA.question: What documents or information may be required to verify my business account?
QA.answer: Wise may ask for some documents or to confirm your details on a business registry to verify your business account.

QA.question: Can I open a business account with Wise online?
QA.answer: Yes, you can open a business account with Wise online, quickly and easily.

QA.question: How can I get my business account verified?
QA.answer: To get your business account verified, read the guide provided by Wise, which outlines the required documents and processes.

QA.question: How does Wise verify my business address?
QA.answer: Wise verifies your business address by asking you to upload a document confirming your business address. It should show your business name, full business address, date of issue, logo or name of the sender, and the nature of the document.

QA.question: What type of document can I provide to confirm my business address?
QA.answer: For a registered business, provide proof from an official business register showing the new address. For sole traders, a utility bill, bank or credit card statement, tax bill, or other government or financial institution-issued document can be provided.

QA.question: Can I submit a utility bill that is older than 3 months to verify my business address?
QA.answer: No, a utility bill, bank statement, or council tax bill can't be older than 3 months to be accepted for address verification.

QA.question: Can I provide a local authority or FCA-authorised institution document that is older than 3 months?
QA.answer: Yes, you can submit a document from a local authority or FCA-authorised institution which was issued within the last 12 months. For example, a yearly tax bill or a letter confirming the opening of a bank account.

QA.question: Can I use a PO Box as my business address?
QA.answer: No, the business address can't be a PO Box.

QA.question: How can I change the country of my business?
QA.answer: To change the country of your business, you will be asked to set up a new profile for your business.

QA.question: How can I change my personal address on my Wise business account?
QA.answer: If you need to change your personal address on your Wise Business account, follow the guide provided on the Wise website to do so.

QA.question: How can I edit details on a business account if my business isn't verified?
QA.answer: On the website, click on your business name, then click View business profile, then click Edit profile and fill in the form. On the Android and iOS apps, go to Account, select the Business account dropdown menu, click Edit business details, and fill in the form.

QA.question: How do I update my business details on the Android and iOS apps?
QA.answer: Go to Account, select the Business account dropdown menu, click Edit business details, and fill in the form.

QA.question: Can I update director or shareholder information myself?
QA.answer: No, for updating director or shareholder information, please get in touch with us.

QA.question: How do I edit details on my business account if it is already verified?
QA.answer: If your business is already verified, please get in touch with us to edit your details.

QA.question: Can I switch between different business accounts on Wise?
QA.answer: Yes, you can easily switch between your business accounts on both the Wise website and mobile app by following the steps provided.

QA.question: How do I switch between accounts on the Wise website?
QA.answer: Click on your name/business name in the top right corner, and you will see your other accounts in the dropdown. Select the account you want to switch to.

QA.question: How do I switch between accounts on the Wise mobile app?
QA.answer: Click on the circle with your profile photo/initials in the top left corner. You will see your Wise accounts under 'Other accounts.' Select the account you want to switch to.

QA.question: Why can't I see the account I'm looking for when trying to switch?
QA.answer: It might be because you signed up with a different email address for that account, or your access has been revoked. Try logging out and logging in again with the right email, or contact an Admin or Owner to regain access.

QA.question: Can I transfer my Wise Business account to someone else?
QA.answer: Yes, you can transfer your Wise Business account to another admin user.

QA.question: What happens to my access after transferring the ownership of my business account?
QA.answer: Once you transfer ownership, your access is fully cancelled. You can't log in anymore, and your business Wise cards will be blocked.

QA.question: Can I be invited back as a user after transferring my account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can be invited as a user by the new Owner or another Admin anytime.

QA.question: Can I change the ownership of my business account using the mobile app?
QA.answer: No, you can only change ownership on the Wise website.

QA.question: What are the steps to transfer the ownership of my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: 1. Go to Manage, 2. Under Business tools, select Team, 3. Select your name, and Change owner, 4. Add an Admin if needed, 5. Choose the new owner from your list of Admins, 6. Select Continue, 7. Confirm the change by selecting Continue and leave account.

QA.question: How can I separate my business account from my personal account?
QA.answer: To separate your business account from your personal account, follow these steps: 1. Log into your business account. 2. Go to Manage panel. 3. Go to Team under Business tools. 4. Click Add team members. 5. Invite your business email as an Admin user. 6. Accept the email invitation and set up the new account. 7. Go back to your current business account, go to Team. 8. Click your name, then Change owner. 9. Choose the Admin as the new Owner and confirm the change.

QA.question: What should I do first to separate my business accounts?
QA.answer: First, change the email address associated with your business account to your personal email. This will allow you to use the same business email address when creating a new account to move the business to.

QA.question: What are the steps to add a new Admin user to my business account?
QA.answer: To add a new Admin user, follow these steps: 1. Log into your business account. 2. Go to Manage on the left-hand panel. 3. Go to Team under Business tools. 4. Choose Add team members at the top. 5. Invite the person's email address as an Admin user.

QA.question: How do I change the owner of my business account?
QA.answer: To change the owner of your business account, follow these steps: 1. Log into your business account. 2. Go to Team under Business tools. 3. Click on your name, then select Change owner. 4. Choose the Admin user you want to be the new Owner, and confirm the change.

QA.question: How can I provide multi-user access to my business account?
QA.answer: You can provide multi-user access by inviting team members to join your business account. Go to Manage on the left-hand panel, then Team under Business tools, and choose Add team members at the top. Invite the team member's email address and assign them a role.

QA.question: How can I verify my Indian business to receive payments?
QA.answer: To verify your Indian business, you need to provide documents such as ID, PAN, bank account details, and business ownership proof. The specific documents depend on your company type (Freelancer, Sole proprietorship, Private limited company, or Limited Liability Partnership). Verification can take up to 2 business days.

QA.question: What are the company types I can choose for my business?
QA.answer: You can choose from 4 company types: Freelancer, Sole proprietorship, Private limited company, and Limited Liability Partnership, based on your business structure and ownership.

QA.question: Which documents do I need to provide for verifying my identity?
QA.answer: For verifying your identity, you can provide one of the following documents: Aadhaar, passport, or driving licence (both sides). The name and date of birth on the ID must match the information on your personal profile.

QA.question: What documents are needed to verify my PAN?
QA.answer: You need to provide your PAN card to verify your tax residency status and generate the e-FIRC. The name on the PAN card should match your personal profile name (Freelancer, Sole proprietorship) or your business/trade name (Private limited company, Limited Liability Partnership).

QA.question: What should I do if my bank account verification has a mismatch error?
QA.answer: If there is a mismatch error, make sure to check the company type you registered with and ensure that the documents and information you provided match the requirements. Freelancers should have their bank account name match their personal profile name, while other business types should have the bank account name match their business profile name.

QA.question: How can I check and modify my profile details?
QA.answer: You can check and modify your personal or business profile details by visiting https://wise.com/profile/view/. Some fields can only be modified if verification is still in progress.

QA.question: What are account details for Wise Business?
QA.answer: Account details are your very own details to receive money in currencies like USD, GBP or EUR with zero fees. It isn't a bank account, but the details work the same way when receiving money.

QA.question: How can I sign up for a Wise Business account?
QA.answer: To sign up for a Wise Business account, fill in the necessary details about your business, choose the currencies you want to have account details for, and finish the verification steps.

QA.question: How do my clients send payments to my Indian business using Wise?
QA.answer: Share your account details with your clients, and they can send you the amount from their bank account or using Wise.

QA.question: What happens after my Indian business receives a payment?
QA.answer: You'll receive a self-service notification to provide invoice and client details. Once resolved, Wise will automatically convert the money into INR and transfer it to your verified Indian bank account within 1-2 days.

QA.question: When will I receive the e-FIRC for the transfer?
QA.answer: You will receive the e-FIRC for the transfer to your email address within 7 days.

QA.question: How long do bank transfers and international SWIFT transfers take to arrive in my account?
QA.answer: Bank transfers using local payment methods take 0-2 working days, while international SWIFT transfers take 2-5 working days.

QA.question: What is the fee for transferring money to my INR bank account?
QA.answer: We charge you an equivalent of 2.50 USD in the requested currency for the transfer to your INR bank account.

QA.question: What is the maximum amount I can receive in my account details?
QA.answer: The maximum amount you can receive in your account details is 10,000 USD per transaction. If the transferred amount exceeds this limit, it will be returned to the sender.

QA.question: How long do I have to provide payer and invoice details after receiving a payment?
QA.answer: You need to provide the payer and invoice details within 7 days from the self-service notification. If not resolved within this time, the money will be returned to the sender.

QA.question: What are the different roles I can assign to my team members in Wise Business?
QA.answer: You can assign Viewer, Employee, Preparer, Payer, and Admin roles to your team members.

QA.question: What can a Viewer do in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Viewers can see all account activity, download statements, download receipts, and manage accounting bank feeds.

QA.question: What can an Employee do in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Employees can spend using their own Wise business card(s) up to pre-set limits and view their own activity.

QA.question: What can a Preparer do in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Preparers can set up single payments for approval, view the account, download statements, download receipts, manage accounting bank feeds, contact Customer Support for general advice, and manage recipients.

QA.question: What can a Payer do in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Payers can make and manage payments, convert between balances, download statements, manage accounting software feeds, and see all account activity.

QA.question: What can an Admin do in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Admins can view and manage everything, add and remove team members, and spend with business card(s).

QA.question: How can I create a custom role in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Go to the Team tab, select Roles, click Create role, add a role name and description, toggle to select accesses for this role, and assign an existing user to this role or set it up later.

QA.question: How can I edit a custom role in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Go to the Team tab, scroll down and edit the role by clicking on the three dots next to the role name. You can also assign the role to another team member.

QA.question: Can team members access my personal account in Wise Business?
QA.answer: No, team members can only access the business account(s) you invited them to, not your personal account.

QA.question: Can an Admin or Employee get their own Wise business card?
QA.answer: Yes, Admins and Employees can have their own Wise business card in supported countries.

QA.question: How do I add a team member to my Wise business account?
QA.answer: To add a team member, go to Manage, select Team under Business tools, click Add team members, enter the team member's email, choose their role, and click Add. They will receive an invitation email.

QA.question: What is the process for removing a team member from my Wise business account?
QA.answer: To remove a team member, go to Manage, select Team under Business tools, click on the team member's name, select Remove, and confirm the removal.

QA.question: How do I change the role of a team member?
QA.answer: To change a team member's role, go to Team under Business tools, select the team member's name, click Change role, choose the new role, and click Change role to confirm.

QA.question: Can I change my own role or the Account Owner's role in Wise?
QA.answer: No, you cannot change your own role or the Account Owner's role. However, the Account Owner can transfer the account to another Admin.

QA.question: How do I accept a Wise team member invitation?
QA.answer: To accept an invitation, go to the invitation email, click Accept the invite, add your email address, create a password, fill in your personal details, and check your notifications for the pending invitation.

QA.question: Can multiple users have access to my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can manage who has access to your business account in the Team section.

QA.question: How can I add people to my business account?
QA.answer: You can add people to your account in the Team section. Follow the instructions provided by Wise.

QA.question: Who can contact Wise about my business account?
QA.answer: For privacy and security reasons, Wise can only give specific details about your account to people you authorise to have access.

QA.question: Can I transfer my Wise Business account to someone else?
QA.answer: Yes, you can transfer your Wise Business account to another Admin user any time. Once you transfer ownership, your access is fully cancelled, and your business Wise cards will be blocked.

QA.question: How do I transfer ownership of my Wise Business account?
QA.answer: To transfer ownership, go to Manage, select Team under Business tools, select your name, click Change owner, choose the new owner from the Admin list, click Continue, and confirm the change by selecting Continue and leave account.

QA.question: Will I be able to log in to the account after transferring ownership?
QA.answer: No, after transferring ownership, your access is fully cancelled, and you can't log in anymore.

QA.question: What happens to my Wise business cards after transferring account ownership?
QA.answer: After transferring account ownership, your Wise business cards will be blocked.

QA.question: Can I be invited back as a user by the new owner or another Admin?
QA.answer: Yes, after transferring ownership, you can be invited as a user by the new owner or another Admin anytime.

QA.question: Where can I make changes to account ownership?
QA.answer: You can only change account ownership on the Wise website.

QA.question: Can I learn more about the types of users a business account can have?
QA.answer: Yes, you can refer to Wise documentation or contact Wise customer support for more information about user types in a business account.

QA.question: How can I check the details of an approved or rejected transfer?
QA.answer: Approved or rejected transfers can be checked in the Activity feed. Transfers waiting for approval can be found in the 'Needs your attention' section on the top of the Home page.

QA.question: How do I find out who approved or rejected a transfer?
QA.answer: You can find out who approved or rejected a transfer by selecting the transfer and viewing its 'transfer details' on the website. If you set up the transfer, you will receive an email notification when it is approved or rejected.

QA.question: How can I manage my email notifications for transfers?
QA.answer: To manage your email notifications for transfers, go to 'Notifications > Transfers and balances'.

QA.question: How do I know why a transfer was rejected?
QA.answer: You can find out why a transfer was rejected by checking the 'Rejection reason' under the transfer’s details section. If no rejection reason is stated, try contacting the team member who rejected the transfer for more information.

QA.question: Who can approve or reject payments in Wise Business?
QA.answer: Currently, only Admins can approve or reject payments.

QA.question: Where can I find the transfers that require approval?
QA.answer: Transfers requiring approval will appear under the 'Needs your attention' section on the top of the Home page.

QA.question: How do I approve or reject a payment?
QA.answer: Select the transfer that requires approval, then click 'Approve' to continue with the payment, or 'Reject' to cancel it.

QA.question: Can I approve or reject payments on the mobile app?
QA.answer: Yes, you can approve or reject payments using the Wise Business mobile app.

QA.question: What should I do after approving a payment?
QA.answer: Once approved, you'll be taken to pay for the transfer.

QA.question: Is it possible to provide a reason when rejecting a payment?
QA.answer: Yes, when rejecting a payment, you may leave a 'Rejection reason' which will be sent to the team member who set the payment up.

QA.question: How do Payment Approvals work?
QA.answer: Payment approvals help control payments on Wise. They are available for Wise currency accounts and can be enabled by setting up an approval rule or adding a team member as a Preparer. Payments requiring approval need one Admin to approve them.

QA.question: Are payment approvals available for all accounts?
QA.answer: Payment approvals are currently only available if you have Wise currency accounts.

QA.question: How can I enable Payment approvals?
QA.answer: You can enable Payment approvals by setting up an approval rule or adding a team member to your account as a Preparer.

QA.question: What is an approval rule?
QA.answer: An approval rule is an amount above which payments will require approval, e.g., all payments above 100 GBP.

QA.question: What is a Preparer role?
QA.answer: Preparer is a role assigned to a team member. All payments set up by a Preparer will require approval regardless of whether or not you have an Approval rule set.

QA.question: Can Admins approve their own payments?
QA.answer: No, Admins cannot approve their own payments. Another Admin will need to approve it.

QA.question: Where can I view transfers awaiting approval?
QA.answer: Transfers awaiting approval will appear under the 'Needs your attention' section on the top of the Home page.

QA.question: How can I receive approval-related notifications?
QA.answer: Ensure you have 'Transfers and balances' notifications turned on to receive approval-related notifications.

QA.question: How do I set up an approval rule in Wise Business?
QA.answer: To set up an approval rule: 1. Go to Account > Limits & Controls. 2. Select approval rules. 3. Select Set approval rule. 4. Enter an amount and currency. 5. Select Save.

QA.question: How can I require approval for every payment in Wise Business?
QA.answer: To require approval for every payment, set an approval rule to 0.

QA.question: Do all payments set up by Preparers need approval?
QA.answer: Yes, all payments set up by Preparers will need approval, regardless of the payment amount or whether you have an approval rule set up.

QA.question: How can I manage or cancel an approval rule in Wise Business?
QA.answer: 1. Open your account and click Manage on the left. 2. Scroll down and click on Limits and controls. 3. Click on Manage rule to edit or delete the approval rule.

QA.question: How can I connect my Wise Business account with my Xero account?
QA.answer: Log in to your Wise Business account, go to the connect page, select Xero, and follow the instructions to give Wise access to your Xero organisation. Then, choose the currencies you want synced and confirm the settings.

QA.question: Do I need a Wise Business account to connect to Xero?
QA.answer: Yes, you need a Wise Business account to connect with Xero. If you don't have one, you can create one and then proceed.

QA.question: Where can I find Wise on the Xero Marketplace?
QA.answer: You can find Wise on the Xero Marketplace by searching for it in the search bar or browsing through the available apps.

QA.question: Can I choose which currencies to sync between Wise and Xero?
QA.answer: Yes, you have full control over which currency balances sync between Wise and Xero bank accounts of the same currency.

QA.question: How often will my transactions be synced from Wise to Xero?
QA.answer: Your transactions moving forward will be synced from Wise to Xero daily.

QA.question: Can I connect multiple Wise accounts to one Xero organisation?
QA.answer: No, you can only connect one Wise account with one Xero organisation.

QA.question: How do I connect my Wise and Xero accounts?
QA.answer: To connect your Wise and Xero accounts, follow the instructions provided by Wise Business for connecting to accounting software.

QA.question: Where can I find the Connection settings?
QA.answer: Once you have connected your Wise and Xero accounts, you can find the Connection settings in your Wise Business account.

QA.question: How do I enable the Bank feeds sync feature?
QA.answer: To enable the Bank feeds sync feature, go to your Connection settings in your Wise Business account and switch on the 'Bank feeds sync' option.

QA.question: How can I change which currencies are synced to Xero?
QA.answer: To change which currencies are synced to Xero, go to Advanced settings on the Connection settings page, and select the desired currencies.

QA.question: Where will my Wise transactions appear in Xero?
QA.answer: Your Wise transactions for the selected balances will appear in your Xero bank accounts of the same currency.

QA.question: How can I connect my Wise Business account to accounting software?
QA.answer: Go to 'Sync options and status' from your Connection settings. You can choose an earlier start date and import previous Wise transactions to Xero.

QA.question: Can I import transactions older than one year?
QA.answer: You can import transactions up to one year using the 'Sync options and status' feature. For older transactions, you need to manually upload statements to Xero.

QA.question: How do I manually upload older statements to Xero?
QA.answer: To manually upload older statements to Xero, download the transaction history from your Wise Business account and import it into Xero using the file upload feature.

QA.question: Can I connect Xero with my personal Wise account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can connect Xero with your personal account, but it's recommended to use your business account.

QA.question: Which account should I use to connect to Xero?
QA.answer: It is recommended to use your business account to connect to Xero.

QA.question: Is it possible to use the Wise API with my business account?
QA.answer: Yes, you can use the Wise API with your business account.

QA.question: Why am I receiving an error message when I try to connect my Xero bank account with Wise?
QA.answer: This error message indicates that the Xero bank account hasn't been configured correctly in Xero, often because it's set up to support another bank or platform.

QA.question: What are my options if my Xero bank account isn't ready to connect with Wise?
QA.answer: You have three options: 1. Edit the chosen bank account in Xero to ensure it's configured correctly. 2. Create a new Xero bank account to connect with Wise. 3. Choose another Xero bank account of the same currency.

QA.question: How can I edit my Xero bank account to connect with Wise?
QA.answer: Log into Xero, go to the Accounting menu, select Bank Accounts, choose Manage Account next to the one you want to connect, click Edit Account Details, find the 'Your bank' field, delete the current bank, search for 'Wise', select it, and save.

QA.question: How can I create a new Xero bank account to connect with Wise?
QA.answer: In Wise, go to Advanced settings from Connection settings, choose 'Create a new account' from the dropdown, enter a new name and click Save.

QA.question: How can I choose another Xero bank account of the same currency to connect with Wise?
QA.answer: Go to Advanced settings from Connection settings in Wise, choose the account from the dropdown, and click Save.

QA.question: How can I connect my Wise account with QuickBooks?
QA.answer: To connect your Wise account to QuickBooks, log in to your QuickBooks account, go to the Banking tab, click Add Account, search for Wise, log in to your Wise account, choose the account and balances you want to connect, set the start date for transactions, and click Connect.

QA.question: What happens after 90 days of connecting my Wise account to QuickBooks?
QA.answer: After 90 days, the authorisation to share your data between Wise and QuickBooks will expire. You will need to authorise sharing your data again at that point.

QA.question: What if my QuickBooks subscription level doesn't allow connection to a Wise account?
QA.answer: If your subscription level with QuickBooks doesn't allow the connection to a Wise account, you won't be able to connect them.

QA.question: How can I set up the Bills feature between Wise and QuickBooks?
QA.answer: To set up the Bills feature, you can search for Wise in the QuickBooks App Store or activate it through the Wise App Marketplace. All unpaid bills will then sync to Wise.

QA.question: Can I connect my Wise account to QuickBooks if my business is registered in a different country?
QA.answer: Yes, you can connect your Wise account to QuickBooks, even if your business is registered in a different country. When searching for Wise, you might find options for different countries; choose the one from the country your business is registered in, although all options should work.

QA.question: How can I disconnect my Wise account from QuickBooks?
QA.answer: To disconnect your Wise account from QuickBooks, go to Settings, click on Connected accounts, and then click Revoke for QuickBooks.

QA.question: Is there an alternative method to disconnect my Wise account from QuickBooks?
QA.answer: Yes, you can use the Wise App Marketplace to disconnect from QuickBooks. Go to your Account, where you can toggle the connection on and off.

QA.question: What features does Wise Business offer?
QA.answer: Wise Business offers multi-user access, accounting, and API usage.

QA.question: How can I fix QuickBooks showing the wrong currency?
QA.answer: To fix this, manually change the currency of your Wise balance in QuickBooks by logging in, going to the Banking tab, clicking Edit account info, and changing the currency of the account to the correct one.

QA.question: Where can I change the currency of my Wise balance in QuickBooks?
QA.answer: You can change the currency of your Wise balance in QuickBooks by going to the Banking tab and clicking Edit account info.

QA.question: What is the first step to fixing the currency issue in QuickBooks?
QA.answer: The first step is logging in to your QuickBooks account.

QA.question: How do I connect my Wise account with my FreeAgent account?
QA.answer: 1. Log in to your FreeAgent account, 2. Go to the Banking tab, 3. Select the bank account for the feed, 4. Select Enable Bank Feed, 5. Search for Wise, 6. Log in to Wise, 7. Choose the balances to connect, 8. Select Connect.

QA.question: Do the currencies of my Wise and FreeAgent accounts have to match when connecting them?
QA.answer: Yes, the currency of your account needs to match the currency of the FreeAgent bank account you are enabling the bank feed for.

QA.question: How often do I need to authorize sharing my data between Wise and FreeAgent?
QA.answer: The authorization to share your data with FreeAgent will expire after 90 days. You will need to re-authorize sharing your data at this point.

QA.question: How can I connect Wise Business to accounting software?
QA.answer: To connect Wise Business to your accounting software, go to Settings, click on Connected accounts, and follow the prompts to connect to the desired software.

QA.question: What steps do I need to take to disconnect my Wise account from FreeAgent?
QA.answer: To disconnect your Wise account from FreeAgent, go to Settings, click on Connected accounts, and click Revoke for FreeAgent.

QA.question: Does Wise Business offer an API?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise Business offers an API for users to integrate with their applications and services.

QA.question: How do I connect my Xero account to my Wise account?
QA.answer: Connect your Xero account to your Wise account, and you can manage the connection from your _Connection settings_.

QA.question: Are there any fees for using the Xero connection with Wise Business?
QA.answer: After August 1, 2023, Xero will apply a 0.1% fee of transfer value for international transfers and a 0.2% fee of transfer value for domestic transfers.

QA.question: Is the 'Import bills to Wise' feature only available for businesses in the UK?
QA.answer: Yes, the 'Import bills to Wise' feature is currently only available for businesses in the UK.

QA.question: What happens when I enable 'Automatically record transactions to Xero'?
QA.answer: When you enable this feature, Wise will automatically mark bills and invoices as paid in Xero when you pay or get paid through Wise.

QA.question: How are Wise fees recorded in Xero?
QA.answer: Wise fees are entered automatically as a separate Expense transaction to 'Wise-service' in a Bank Account called 'Bank charges (Wise)', which you can find in your Chart of Accounts.

QA.question: How are cash withdrawals recorded in Xero?
QA.answer: Cash withdrawals are recorded automatically in an account called 'Petty cash (Wise)', which can be found in your Chart of Accounts.

QA.question: Why are new Contacts being created in Xero?
QA.answer: New Contacts are created automatically for any incoming or outgoing transaction where Wise is unable to match with one of your existing Contacts, usually because you don't have one saved yet. This allows transactions to be recorded more accurately.

QA.question: What is a batch payment?
QA.answer: A batch payment is a tool that allows you to create and send multiple payments at once by uploading a file. It can also be referred to as a bulk payment, mass payout, or mass payment.

QA.question: How much does it cost to use the batch payment tool?
QA.answer: The batch payment tool is free to use.

QA.question: How many transfers can I create with a single batch payment file?
QA.answer: With a single .CSV or .XLSX file, you can create up to 1,000 transfers.

QA.question: What file formats can be used for batch payments?
QA.answer: .CSV or .XLSX file formats can be used for batch payments.

QA.question: Who can benefit from using the batch payment tool?
QA.answer: Businesses that need to make a large number of payouts to customers, freelancers, employees, investors, or suppliers around the world can benefit from using the batch payment tool.

QA.question: How can I contact the Sales team if I am a medium-large business?
QA.answer: To contact the Sales team as a medium-large business, simply _Get in touch_ with them through the Wise Business platform.

QA.question: Can I automate batch payments?
QA.answer: Yes, you can automate batch payments by integrating with Wise's open API.

QA.question: Are there any extra charges or premium subscriptions for using the API?
QA.answer: No, there are no extra charges or premium subscriptions for using the API.

QA.question: How long does it take to get API tokens?
QA.answer: It only takes a few minutes to get your API tokens.

QA.question: What benefits can I get from using the Wise API?
QA.answer: By using the Wise API, you can automate payments, connect your business tools to Wise, and create other ways to manage your finances.

QA.question: Where can I learn more about the Wise open API?
QA.answer: To learn more about the Wise open API, you can explore their documentation and get a sandbox account to test the integration.

QA.question: Can I pay for different currencies in a single batch?
QA.answer: Yes, you can pay out to multiple currencies when using batch payments.

QA.question: How can I choose the recipient's currency in a batch payment?
QA.answer: Once you've selected the 'Send to bank accounts' template, you can choose the recipient's currency from the dropdown menu and the required fields will be updated based on the chosen currency.

QA.question: How do I add more currencies to my batch payment?
QA.answer: Click on 'Add Row' in the template builder, select another currency from the dropdown menu, and add another row to include those fields in the template. Repeat this process for as many currencies as needed.

QA.question: What is a batch payment template?
QA.answer: A batch payment template is a downloadable .CSV format file used to help you get started with batch payments. It can be opened using a spreadsheet app like Microsoft Excel or Numbers.

QA.question: What types of batch payment templates are available?
QA.answer: Available templates include Send by Email (if you don't know the recipient's bank details), Send to Saved Recipients (download the list of all saved recipients), and Send to Bank Accounts (send to new recipients).

QA.question: Which file formats can I save and upload my batch file in?
QA.answer: You can save and upload your batch file as a .CSV or .XLSX file.

QA.question: How do I fill in my batch payment template?
QA.answer: Download the template, open it with a spreadsheet app like Microsoft Excel or Numbers and fill out the rows according to the column headers. Each row represents a transfer. Save and upload as a .CSV or .XLSX file.

QA.question: How many transfers can I add to my batch payment file?
QA.answer: You can add up to 1,000 transfers per batch file.

QA.question: Can I use multiple recipient currencies in a single batch payment file?
QA.answer: Yes, each file can contain multiple recipient currencies but only one source currency.

QA.question: Which file formats are supported for batch payment uploads?
QA.answer: You can upload your batch payment file as .CSV or .XLSX formats.

QA.question: Do I need to fill all columns in the batch payment template?
QA.answer: No, 'E-mail' and 'Payment reference' columns are optional and can be left blank.

QA.question: Why do I get an error when I upload my batch payment file?
QA.answer: There could be several reasons including wrong file format, file size larger than 5MB, more than one source currency, more than 1,000 transfers or recipients, changed header row column names, use of special characters or punctuation, or blank necessary fields.

QA.question: What file formats are supported for batch payment files?
QA.answer: Supported formats for batch payment files are .CSV and .XLSX.

QA.question: What is the maximum file size for batch payment files?
QA.answer: The maximum file size for batch payment files is 5MB.

QA.question: Can my batch payment file include more than one source currency?
QA.answer: No, batch payment files should not contain more than one source currency.

QA.question: How many transfers or recipients can I include in my batch payment file?
QA.answer: You can include up to 1,000 transfers or recipients in your batch payment file.

QA.question: What should I do if I still get error messages after fixing and reuploading my batch payment file?
QA.answer: If you still get error messages after fixing and reuploading your batch payment file, please email the output file with the error messages to the customer support.

QA.question: Can I use special characters or punctuation in the batch payment file?
QA.answer: Avoid using special characters or punctuation in the batch payment file as they might cause errors.

QA.question: What should I do if some necessary fields are left blank in my batch payment file?
QA.answer: Fill in the blank necessary fields before uploading your batch payment file to avoid errors.

QA.question: Can I use Wise for multi-user access, accounting and API?
QA.answer: Yes, Wise Business supports multi-user access, accounting and API integrations.

QA.question: Is it possible to use Wise for running payroll on Time Doctor?
QA.answer: Yes, you can use Wise's batch payments tool with Time Doctor to pay your overseas employees.

QA.question: How do I integrate Wise with Time Doctor for payroll?
QA.answer: To set up Wise integration in Time Doctor, follow the instructions provided in their setup guide.

QA.question: What is Wise's batch payments tool?
QA.answer: Wise's batch payments tool is a feature that allows you to easily pay multiple recipients at once, making it ideal for payroll purposes.

QA.question: What are the two payment options for paying for batch payments?
QA.answer: The two payment options are: 1) pay by local bank transfer and 2) use balances already in your Wise Business account.

QA.question: How can I pay for my batch using Option 1?
QA.answer: For Option 1, you will be provided with our bank details. You need to send the total amount of your batch to us via bank transfer and click 'I have paid'. We'll distribute the correct amounts to your recipients upon receiving the money.

QA.question: How can I pay for my batch using Option 2?
QA.answer: For Option 2, you can select 'pay from one of your Wise Business balances'.

QA.question: Where can I learn how to top up my Wise Business balances?
QA.answer: You can find instructions on how to top up your balances on Wise's help articles or by reaching out to their customer support.

QA.question: How are the fees calculated for batch payments?
QA.answer: The fees for each transfer in the batch are summed up, and the total fee is displayed to the user before paying.

QA.question: How can I make sure my recipient gets a certain amount of money in their home currency using Batch payments?
QA.answer: On the template creation screen, click on 'Source currency' and change it to 'Target currency'. Then, type in the amount you'd like for the recipient to get and we'll calculate how much you'd need to send us in your currency.

QA.question: Where can I find the 'Target currency' option?
QA.answer: You can find 'Target currency' under the 'Amount currency' section while filling out the 'Send to bank accounts' template.

QA.question: What happens if I select 'source' as the 'Amount currency'?
QA.answer: If you select 'source' as the 'Amount currency', we'll deduct the fees first from your payment and send the rest to the recipient in their currency.

QA.question: Can I specify either source or target currency when using 'Send by email' and 'Send to saved recipients' templates?
QA.answer: Yes, you can specify either source or target currency under the 'Amount currency' header for both 'Send by email' and 'Send to saved recipients' templates.

QA.question: What is the Wise API?
QA.answer: The Wise API is a tool that helps you connect your business with Wise to automate your interaction with them. It enables automation of transfers, improves user experience, and is free to use.

QA.question: Which banks and businesses are using Wise API?
QA.answer: Banks like N26, Monzo, LHV, Aspire, Shinhan, and businesses like Xero, GoCardless, Deel, Remote, Emburse, Preply, Gameflip, and Bolt are using Wise API to streamline their cross-border payments.

QA.question: Can personal customers use Wise API?
QA.answer: Yes, personal customers can also use Wise API for their day-to-day transfers.

QA.question: What functionalities does Wise API offer?
QA.answer: Wise API allows you to power your cross-border/domestic payouts, pay out to bank accounts or email recipients, monitor transfer statuses live, get statements for reconciliation and accounting purposes, receive mid-market exchange and low-cost transparent fees, and monitor payments received to your Wise local account details.

QA.question: What Wise API cannot do?
QA.answer: Wise API cannot collect debit/credit card payments, upload Batch Payments over API, or create reusable plug-ins for websites.

QA.question: How can I get started with the Wise API?
QA.answer: You can get started by visiting the Wise API documentation, which includes guidelines and a getting started guide. Make sure to register for an account on Wise and get verified first. Check the Acceptable Use Policy page to ensure compatibility.

QA.question: Should I contact the Sales team for medium-large businesses?
QA.answer: Yes, if you're a medium-large business, you should get in touch with the Wise Sales team for assistance with the API.
